description:
Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you‚Äôve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What‚Äôs different about a Founding Engineer is you‚Äôre first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don‚Äôt. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you‚Äôll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

‚Ä¶ change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it‚Äôs likely you‚Äôre a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We‚Äôre striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you‚Äôre curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

position: Mobile and Front End Developer (React/React Native)

location.city: New York City ‚Ä¢ Washington DC ‚Ä¢ Maryland ‚Ä¢ Remote

description:
We‚Äôre growing, we‚Äôre hiring, and we‚Äôre looking for awesome people! If you want a basic job, look elsewhere. If you want to be part of an amazing, tight, and mission-driven team, look no further!

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum and work closely with the CTO. Lots of room for growth with the company.

Join us and help us make a difference for people around the world.

If you're passionate about what you do, you do it well, and are looking to be a part of an awesome movement, BurnAlong is the right place for you.

We're currently searching for a Mobile and Front End Developer to work on our most important initiatives.

We are looking for a problem solver, not just a doer. Become part of a culture of integrity, innovation, and creativity as we revolutionize an entire industry.

Ideal candidates need not apply. Exceptional and motivated applicants only. Join us as we help people & businesses achieve better outcomes.

Job Summary:

BurnAlong is looking for a Mobile and Front End Developer to help us rapidly iterate and improve.

We‚Äôre looking for someone who understands what it‚Äôs like to be part of a startup; someone who works hard and has the optimism to plow through any challenge with a positive attitude.

We‚Äôre looking for the perfect fit for the team, not the role - as long as you have a strong skills, a desire to learn, and a positive attitude, we want to hear from you!

Qualifications and Skills:

  • 5+ years of development experience with at least 2 using React / React Native
  • React Web Frontend Development
  • React-native Web Development
  • Mobile Development Experience & Eco-systems
  • Node.js Experience a Plus
  • Some Python Web Experience (Or Equivalent) a Plus
  • API Integration (Rest) & Data Familiarity
  • CSS/SASS and Ui/Ux Implementation
  • Automated Testing: Basic JS or Python Test Frameworks a Plus
  • Good Communication, Planning/Organization & Teamwork Skills

About you:

  • You are a good person and recognize others are too. You maintain respect of others while working through tough challenges and tight timelines;
  • You‚Äôre passionate about building a great product and you‚Äôre a quick learner who is passionate about code. You take initiative to self-teach when needed;
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team with a strong attention to detail.
  • You approach problems from a product perspective, thinking through how the user will interact with what you're building;
  • You have strong communication skills. You ask questions, let others know when you need help, and tell others what you need;
  • You're a problem solver. You believe the best work is the result of finding the simplest solution to complex challenges;
  • You have a strong desire to learn and try new things!

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences‚Ä¶ with instructors who we don‚Äôt know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We‚Äôve built BurnAlong ‚Äì to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood ‚Äì authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

Learn something every day building real products for real users

What you will learn:

  • How our product development process works from inception to deployment
  • How to write quality, performant, well-tested code in Python/Django and ES6/React
  • How to collaborate with other engineers over code review and discussion

What you will do:

There are no intern projects. We treat you like full-time engineers and get you onboarded as quickly as possible.

  • Ship code to users in your first week and every week after
  • Coordinate and collaborate with other engineers on projects small and large
  • Take ownership and lead your own project within 8 weeks

Examples of past intern work include:

  • Architecting the backend database schema and designing the REST API for our trading platform
  • Implementing the redesign and refactor of our entire investment search page in a reactive framework with front-end routing and browser history
  • Building a process for users to upload and unpack zip files and replicate the folder structure in our database

Benefits & opportunities:

  • Autonomy - Work autonomously to set your own timeline, architecture, and task breakdown
  • Mentorship - Meet with mentors one on one to develop technical and non-technical skills
  • 10% Time - Every other Monday, utilize your curiosity to develop your technical skills on personal projects
  • Snack - We're not unique here but we love our coffee and snacks and we've got you covered

What we are looking for:

  • Motivated individuals looking for industry experience and to develop their technical skills
  • People with a foundational understanding of software engineering
  • Curiosity for technologies, concepts, and practices
  • Individuals who enjoy collaborating with roles outside of engineering

What are our goals:

We think it should be just as easy to trade in private companies as it is in public companies. Many believe that startup employee equity is only worth something if the company IPOs or is acquired. However, with a robust, centralized, efficient market to trade in private companies, that equity becomes liquid and is valuable from the day it vests. We are building that market for stockholders and institutional investors, and we could use your help doing it.

Other Details

  • Given the uncertain circumstances around the pandemic, we are only accepting candidates residing in the Bay Area.

Learn more about us at https://www.zanbato.com or https://www.facebook.com/zanbatoinc/

Due to the ongoing pandemic, our interview and onboarding processes will remain fully remote until further notice. At times like this, we're even more committed to providing you support and flexibility while you interview and onboard for your new job.

About Dashlane:

Dashlane is a web and mobile app that simplifies password management for people and businesses. We empower organizations to protect company and employee data, while helping everyone easily log in to the accounts they need‚Äîanytime, anywhere. A better digital future starts with secure access.

Our team in Paris, New York, and Lisbon is united by a strong sense of community and passion for improving the digital experience. Over 15 million users and 20,000 businesses in 180 countries use Dashlane for a faster, simpler, and more secure internet.

About the role:

Since its inception, Dashlane has been a data-driven company and the Data & Analytics team is the brain that powers all our business decisions across the entire company. As we scale, the need for more analytics is growing every day. The data engineering team spans the full cycle from data collection to data modeling and uses advanced technologies to process and report data. As a Data Engineer Intern, your main mission will be to be involved in the entire development lifecycle, working closely with data engineers and data analysts. This 6-month internship is a great opportunity to learn how to manipulate data on a real product, with cutting-edge technology on a key project for Dashlane, while being mentored by more Senior Data Engineers. Your work will guide every small and large decision we make on our product development roadmap and our company strategy. This is a unique opportunity to take part in an exciting adventure and truly contribute to the success of Dashlane.

Location-specific information:

You will be based in Paris, or remotely anywhere in France, with English as your working language.

The internship start date will be between September 2021 and March 2022.

At Dashlane you will:

  • Enhance your data engineering skills and be mentored by true professionals
  • Take part in the Agile development of a truly awesome product
  • Build data pipelines and python-based ETL tools for acquiring, processing, and delivering data
  • Develop and validate data models and schemas in our data warehouse that enable performant, intuitive analysis
  • Handle the challenges that come with managing terabytes of data
  • Collaborate with business leaders and analysts to define key metrics and build reporting to monitor and understand company performance
  • Develop the server applications and APIs that are used by our Data Team

Basic Requirements:

  • Fluent in English (written and verbal)
  • 1+ years of experience with SQL coding
  • 1+ years of experience with scripting languages such as Python or an object-oriented language such as Java or Scala
  • You have used GitHub or Gitlab before. Experience setting up CI/CD pipelines is a plus

The ideal candidate will also:

  • Be curious about Data Engineering and eager to learn
  • Be a good team player with strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Can address a task that is well defined with an obvious path to implementation
  • Is not afraid to ask questions and keep learning when stuck, or even better, before!
  • Be curious about dataOps and has a basic knowledge of a cloud provider. AWS preferably.
  • Be a strong (data) problem solver and do not fear working with (big) data
  • Be versatile, have strong attention to detail, and generally a hands-on attitude
  • Wants to be an active contributor to one of the most challenging projects at Dashlane
  • Be comfortable with working remotely
  • Have tried Dashlane and uses it ‚Äì all of us here are passionate about the product!

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging at Dashlane:

As a truly international company‚Äîfounded in Paris and split between Paris, New York, and Lisbon‚ÄîDashlane thrives off diverse perspectives. We value all aspects of diversity: gender identity, sexual orientation, ability, ethnic origin, social background, age, lifestyle, and more. We are committed to hiring a diverse community and fostering a culture where everyone is heard and belongs.

position: Product Development and Infrastructure Operations Intern
description:
WorkBoard

Work with purpose.

WorkBoard‚Äôs mission is to help companies and the people in them achieve their best results. We pioneered the Enterprise Results Management solution category so leaders can communicate strategy and align efforts well in a faster changing world, and so team members are energized by the purpose and impact of their work. Our customers drive faster growth and competitive advantage because they have higher alignment, real-time transparency, and sharper focus on the results that matter. Companies like Cisco, Microsoft, Juniper, Workday, 3M, Zuora, Anthem, Humana, and many others use WorkBoard‚Äôs platform, expert services, and professional certification programs to achieve their ambitious vision.

WorkBoard has built a clear lead in the space ‚Äì it is the size of all the other OKR app providers combined, in large part because its founders and team members are experienced company builders focused on true, differentiated value for our customers. WorkBoard is backed by top-tier venture investors including Andreessen Horowitz, GGV Capital, Microsoft‚Äôs M12 Fund, SoftBank Investment Advisers, and Workday Ventures.

THE OPPORTUNITY

In this role you will join our Technology Operations team for the summer, supporting Product Development and the larger Workboard Organization. You will have the opportunity to partner with business leaders and a broad cross section of employees across Product, Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Finance and People teams. You‚Äôll build transparent, repeatable processes and help strengthen our culture of continuous improvement in areas of Program Management, Release Management, IT, business operations and analytics.

This person will ensure that all priorities are defined, specified, planned and delivered to meet defined targets, mandates and ongoing business imperatives. This position applies solid multi-tasking, program management, analytics and self-starting skills & experience in working with internal and external stakeholders executing initiatives with agility, nimbleness and on time delivery. You will work on projects that impact business performance and will play a key role in supporting critical strategic operations efforts in a fast paced hyper growth start-up.

Your projects for the internship will include:

  • Supporting our Release Management activities to assure our weekly releases are deployed and signed off with transparency and alignment across our Engineering, Product and Testing organizations.
  • Driving our Product Development Onboarding activities: assigning new hires to the right training, post training creation of weekly polls and analytics to assure we are providing sufficient training to expedite effectiveness and maintain our targeted NPS.
  • Track and manage on-time renewal and ample availability of software subscriptions managed by our IT team to support execution in a hyper-growth start-up.
  • Be central point of contact in our PMO to curate, consolidate and maintain the necessary content for our Product Development Intranet, including FAQs and How to docs. You will participate as a key core team member as Workboard designs and deploys this new Intranet.
  • Work with IT Management to assure all WorkBoard equipment assigned to employees have required Asset Tags on their equipment.
  • Work with Security Ops, Dev Ops and Tech Ops teams to consolidate all contract obligations and establish a calendar to assure that the Product Development maintains and delivers all commitments on time to meet customers and vendor requirements.
  • Facilitate communication, participation and delivery of bi-weekly happy hours and monthly town halls to support our Product Development team.

COMING IN

  • Ability to work effectively as part of a diverse team,‚ÄØhave fun and get stuff done‚ÄØ
  • Good presentation skills ‚Äì verbal and written
  • Strong analytic mindset; has data driven approach to problem solving
  • Self-starter, quick learner and detail oriented.
  • Available for approximately a 10-12 week summer internship and available to work 40 hours per week.
  • Currently enrolled in an accredited college or university.

OUR VALUES - WE LIVE BY THE 4 Hs

Humble experts ~ Hungry for the opportunity ~ Intellectually honest ~ Operating as one happy team

A FEW OF OUR AWESOME BENEFITS

  • Flexible PTO & sick days
  • Paid holidays
  • Quarterly All-Hands Meetings
  • And much more!

THE WORKBOARD STORY

WorkBoard provides a powerful, modern results platform to help companies achieve their growth plans. Unlike most enterprise software, our solution is important to every employee, so we strive to set the high bar for capabilities that delight and enable everyone to be more successful at work. WorkBoard is strategic to companies and personally relevant to the people that work in them.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace committed to building a team culture that celebrates learning, diversity and inclusion. If you‚Äôre hungry to grow your skills while growing a company, your sense of urgency matches the size of our market opportunity, and you value and enable team mates‚Äô contributions, then come join us!

Algomo is a multilingual chatbot engine that provides instant resolutions to customer and employee queries in any language üåé .

We have developed a unique technology that is fluent in 109 languages. All the other commercial players (including Google, Microsoft, Amazon, IBM etc) combined support just 33. Algomo supports an additional 76 languages, bringing AI to the 1.3 Billion people who are currently left behing and are mainly living in emerging economies.

Our mission is to facilitate access to digital goods to anyone in the world, no matter what language they speak.

Algomo was founded in February 2020, by a technical CEO (ex VP of Data Science at Barclays), and is backed by research grantsf from UK and EU, is already generating revenue.

We also have pilots with P&G, Airports, Banks and the public sector.

Here is a 2-minute video demonstrating how the technology works.

The role

As a data science intern, you will have the opportunity to work alongside the technical CEO, who built the core technology, as well the rest of the technical and commercial team which is distributed across the globe.

We are using cutting edge NLP techniques (including zero-shot learning, multi-task learning, and transfer learning) to solve a real word problem of global importance.

Responsibilities

Improve/develop our core ML models, algorithms, and data sets running in production that are fuelling Algomo's contextual and language agnostic search.
Design, develop, test, deploy, support and evolve software and ML models.
Work on data pipelines, ETL and general data processing tasks.
Participate in an agile delivery process
Apply data scraping and data search algorithms
Document, collaborate and share your learnings with the rest of the team.
But more importantly, learn and grow as an individual!

Qualifications / Skills

On your way towards a degree (BSc, MSc or Ph.D.) in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics or similar scientific field
Experience using Python both for Data Science as well as software engineering.
Project experience in machine learning and especially in NLP
Attention to component reusability, data sharing and security.
Able to explain complex concepts in simple terms and be able to collaborate with a globally distributed team
Entrepreneurial, and a problem-solver who thrives in an autonomous environment.
Comfortable with being dropped into challenging technical problems and enjoy a fast-paced environment with constant growth and change
Having worked in AWS and experience with Docker and CI is a great plus.
Perks

This is a rare opportunity to be part of a truly innovative and global product from the ground up, and join early a startup that will soon be a growing business of exceptional engineers working on the latest technologies.
You will gain practical experience in the research and development of novel Machine Learning applications
You will work closely with a team of technologists and business developers in a very flat structure obtaining a great understanding of how an early-stage startup really works.
You will have the opportunity to join the company full-time post-internship after we have gone through our seed funding round.
You will experience coming to work in a vibrant environment at Natwest Accelerator in London (once lockdown is over)

Algomo is a diverse team and we promote equal opportunities in hiring.

This is an unpaid internship until funding is secured.

Hello! Thank you for your interest in Sigma Ratings.

Sigma Ratings (‚ÄúSigma‚Äù) is an MIT-incubated and venture-backed global data and analytics firm that helps clients better manage risk that may impact credit, credibility and reputation. Sigma‚Äôs unique products leverage cutting-edge computer science and deep domain expertise to convert the world‚Äôs data into actionable insight that powers decision-making at global financial institutions, corporates and governments.

Sigma‚Äôs core values are collaboration, curiosity, and integrity. Working in a complex domain with a small, globally distributed team requires us to actively work together, embrace learning, and hold ourselves accountable to each other.

We believe engineers do their best work when they have interesting problems to solve with a smart, kind team. Our engineers value pragmatism and sharing. We aim to use the right tools to build incrementally and iterate rapidly. We collaborate on designs and implementations because many heads are better than one. We share ownership, knowledge, rewards, and pain because we are a team and teams build together.

What You will Do

  • Partner with product and engineering to design scalable engineering solutions
  • Build and maintain production systems, including services (Go, Python, Scala), the UI (React/Redux), databases (PostgreSQL), docker with some AWS devops work
  • Build or provision new services, infrastructure and UI for greenfield projects such as public APIs along with other product development ideas
  • Regularly participate in code reviews
  • Weigh in on architectural decisions and participate in our RFC process
  • Mentor and share knowledge with the rest of the team

Our stack

  • Javascript/ES6 (React)

  • Golang (Echo)

  • Scala (Play Framework)

  • Python (Databricks)

  • Amazon ECS Fargate, RDS, Kinesis, and more,

  • Docker, Grafana, Prometheus and GitLab CI

Qualifications
Not all qualified candidates will have all these requirements, so if you have some or most of them, we‚Äôd love for you to apply, especially if you have some nice-to-haves from below!

Required for this role:

  • Solid communication skills in English is a MUST
  • Golang ~2 years experience is a MUST
  • React / Redux ~1 year experience is a MUST

Other important skills:

  • Approximately 5 or more years of software development including:
  • design, implementation, and testing of production features
  • maintenance and monitoring of production systems

Solid working experience with: (Ideally, at least one year of professional use)

  • Scala
  • Python

Other important attributes:

Approximately 3 or more years of experience working with cross-functional stakeholders (product, sales, ops, etc)

  • Preference for rapid iteration or prototyping over extended debate
  • Familiarity with build tools and automated build pipelines
  • AWS experience, especially with managed services such as ECS over EC2
  • Experience with Docker

Nice to have

  • Experience developing a public facing RESTful APIs
  • Experience with search engines like Elastic or Solr
  • Nginx, Grafana
  • Experience with one or any Graph DB

What We Offer
Competitive compensation and company stock

  • Fully remote work - Standup at 10am EST
  • Generous vacations

Sigma is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

Tari Labs was founded to steward the development of the core infrastructure to facilitate this shift for everyone on Earth. We are achieving this through stewarding the development of a default-private digital asset protocol called Tari. In addition to stewarding the development of this new distributed source of truth, we are also building the first killer application that will make use of it. This killer app is called Yat, and it is one of the fastest-growing consumer products of all time. What is a Yat?

Yats are self-sovereign emoji usernames that become your universal internet identity, website URL, and payment address. Imagine a world where instead of being "johnsmith234" someone can be üî•üêâ across every chat app, social network, metaverse, and beyond.

Tari Labs was founded by Riccardo Spagni, the former lead maintainer of Monero, and Naveen Jain, the founder of Sparkart. We are backed by Blockchain Capital, Pantera Capital, Multicoin Capital, Trinity Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Canaan Partners, Slow Ventures, and many more of the very best investors in the world.

We are looking for people who are fearless, who want to fight for internet freedom for all, and who believe that privacy is a basic human right for everyone on Earth. We want to collaborate with people who push their own definition of excellence every day, who desire full ownership over their ability to make a meaningful impact, and who don‚Äôt want to be a cog in a giant machine. If this sounds exciting to you, join us.

Open source is vital to Tari, we rely on many amazing projects from the community to run our business and regularly share with the world what we build internally. We are looking for a motivated, forward-thinking individual to take Tari‚Äôs open-source operations to the next level.

About You:

  • You have the passion for open source, you have contributed to multiple open-source projects, get why it exists, why it works, and where it makes the most sense.
  • You dig into creating sustainable systems and communities that continue to exist long after you are gone.
  • You are no stranger to the infrastructure around open source projects - both the technical aspects like repository/project management and the human aspects like community relations and governance.
  • You are a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment.
  • You are great at juggling competing priorities and figuring out the best way to stack rank to achieve our ultimate objectives near-term, mid-term, and long-term.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You are comfortable within distributed work environments, collaborating across time zones and cultures.
  • You want to make the world a better place in the specific areas where Tari Labs is determined to make an enormous impact: internet freedom and privacy for all.
  • You are intrigued by our unique mix of building an iconic company by building a deeply passionate community filled with love, a highly useful product that allows people to express themselves in entirely new ways, and by leveraging the Tari blockchain as our ultimate source of truth.

What You‚Äôll Do:

  • Focus on our desire to contribute to various large open-source projects
  • Interact with existing contributors, maintainers, and community members, in order to ensure we are deeply ingrained in that project‚Äôs ecosystem
  • Work with engineering teams to write specific code, where necessary, and submit pull requests

  • You thrive in challenging environments where priorities shift frequently. Ability to operate effectively in both tactical and strategic capacities -- you can comfortably adjust your altitude and roll up your sleeves as needed.

Bonus Points:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (MS is a plus) or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred, but not required.
  • Experience as a maintainer, or lead maintainer, on an open-source project, preferred.
  • Comfortable speaking and presenting at development conferences

Kepler is on a Mission to bring the internet to space. Incorporated in 2015, Kepler‚Äôs guiding star is to enable the space economy through the creation of a communication network in Low Earth Orbit (LEO) that will provide connectivity services to other space missions, be they on orbit in LEO, MEO, GEO, or beyond. With an expanding base of early customers and our first 15 satellites in orbit, Kepler is continuing to grow and expand its most important asset ‚Äì the Team! Based out of our HQ in Toronto and with an office in the UK and a newly formed office in the US we are building towards a truly global company delivering a product for the whole world.

We‚Äôre on the hunt for a top-tier Hardware Engineering Intern. Your focus will be on assisting the development and test of hardware, specifically hardware related to both our space-based communications payloads as well as ground-based assets. We are looking for exceptional candidates with the below experience along with any unique abilities that could be used to augment our hardware team. Here is a little more detail on what you can expect to work on:

Responsibilities:

  • Design schematics and PCB layout
  • Own new designs from start to finish or iterate on existing designs based on new feature requests and lessons learnt including switch mode power supplies, high speed design, and analog design
  • Assist with part selection and new project scoping and architecture
  • Participate in design reviews for all active designs
  • Perform functional and performance testing on individual boards or integrated sub-systems as part of prototype bring up, including development of test boards
  • Participate in pathfinding activities, new process planning, and design specification development

Requirements:

  • 3+ years in an electrical engineering degree program (currently enrolled)
  • Significant involvement in a hardware design (schematic and PCB layout) outside of class projects
  • Experience with one or more CAD tools (Altium, Eagle, Allegro, KiCad, Upverter, etc.)
  • Comfortable in a lab environment and experience using standard tools such as oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, multimeters, VNA‚Äôs, etc.
  • Ability to troubleshoot hardware issues
  • Ability to work in a team and independently with little supervision

Bonus Points:

  • Experience in a University design team or building circuits for a personal project
  • Python scripting experience
  • Knowledge of CubeSats

  • Assist in the design of new RF hardware by performing component selection, schematic capture, layout and fabrication as well as design reviews

position: MBA Summer Intern - Technical Product Management
description:
This is a remote position

Our Company:

Today, 1 in 3 Americans say they suffer from mental health problems like anxiety, depression, or insomnia. Despite this mental health epidemic, seeing a psychiatrist can take up to 3 months and cost as much as $500.

Shocked? Us too. That‚Äôs why we started Cerebral, a telemedicine-first mental health startup. We are breaking down the barriers to access mental healthcare so that anybody can get the care they need immediately. We provide tens of thousands of individuals across the nation with medication management, therapy, and counseling services. We launched publicly in January 2020 and are growing at over 40% month-over-month, and need your help.

How you will contribute:

  • Manage specific project(s) or initiative(s) end-to-end during your summer internship
  • Identify and implement initiatives that move company metrics; partnering with cross-functional teams to improve systems that drive company-wide change
  • Build beautiful products that change the lives of patients and providers by improving the access and outcome of mental healthcare
  • Utilize a combination of metrics, interviews, stakeholder strategy, and market data to inform the product roadmap
  • Own the end to end strategy and feature development while partnering with engineering for telehealth visit and communications user experiences for both patients and providers to deliver a continuously
  • Demonstrate a mix of intelligence, integrity, domain knowledge, verbal agility, and diplomacy which allows you to rapidly earn the trust of the organization
  • Own the delivery of OKRs, define KPIs and their drivers, while meeting SLAs
  • Inspire, champion, and coach as the need arises

Skills you‚Äôll bring:

  • 3+ years' experience at a top-tier management consulting firm, investment banking, and/or experience in a Product, Business Operations, Internal Strategy or cross-functional operational role at a technology company
  • Accepted into an M.B.A. program
  • Eagerness to work independently with a strong sense of ownership
  • Ability to navigate ambiguity, prioritize and juggle multiple priorities with cross-functional stakeholders while hitting deadlines on time sensitive projects
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills and ability to develop strong working relationships
  • Resourcefulness, persistence, and ability to thrive in fast paced, entrepreneurial environment
  • You have sharp attention to detail with a natural feel for numbers and data, and have a high degree of accuracy in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment
  • You are proactive and have a positive attitude with a can-do, service-oriented mentality

About You:

  • Passionate about improving the access and outcomes of mental healthcare.
  • Strategic thinker with a pulse on the market.
  • Visionary
  • Utilize data to inform both tactical and strategic decisions
  • Adept at prioritizing value and shipping complex products requiring coordination across multiple teams
  • Love working with some of the best world-class engineers, product managers, and architects.
  • Strive to excel, innovate and take pride in your work
  • Work well with other leaders

Bonus points:

  • You are familiar with our tools & systems - Asana, Looker, Iterable, Google Optimize, Chargebee, Google docs, MS Office
  • You have experience with AB testing and leveraging data/analytics to evaluate outcomes
  • You have experience with telemedicine or mental health care start ups

Must be based in the United States, and legally authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. We are not able to sponsor work visas at this time.

The Celo mission is to build a financial system that creates the conditions for prosperity for everyone.

Celo aims to remove the barriers for large-scale adoption of cryptocurrencies as means-of-payment. Using a novel address-based encryption algorithm, the Celo protocol makes sending money as easy as sending a text. Additionally, Celo uses stable-value tokens pegged to fiat currencies, like the US Dollar, to minimize volatility. Celo is an open protocol enabling many to participate in the system, even with a budget Android smartphone. The first application launching on the Celo platform is a social payments and money transfer app, aimed at developing markets.

We are looking to hire interns for a fully remote, 12 week software development opportunity to assist on our Protocol and Applications Engineering teams.

About Us:

  • We are a full-stack company i.e. we are building both blockchain protocols and the user experiences on top of them
  • We are experienced startup founders and operators
  • We are highly technical, with backgrounds at places like Google and MIT
  • We are mission driven with a big goal: to bring sound currency and property rights to those who need it most
  • We have a strong engineering culture, which values open-source

You will:

  • Implement, test, and audit the stability and/or identity portion of the Celo protocol
  • Build back-end services that power our APIs
  • Help to hit product milestones by writing high quality, well tested code
  • Perform and participate in code reviews
  • Work in a high performance scrum team
  • Collaborate with product and design teams

You have:

  • A strong passion for Celo's mission
  • Ability to write high quality, well tested code
  • Strong experience developing production software
  • Strong communication skills and ability to lead technical discussions
  • Experience building software that is reusable, extensible, and modular
  • A passion for testing and achieving high test coverage

  • Enthusiasm to work in a startup environment

cLabs ("Celo Labs") started Celo in 2018 and is one of many contributors to the open source project Celo. cLabs builds financial technology to enable prosperity of all beings.

cLabs is a Teal organization, a method of decentralized management and organizational governance. Roles are defined around the work, not people, and there is a high degree of autonomy. As such, we're all proud to hold the job title of "Partner." For more information on our culture, we encourage you to check out our blog at https://medium.com/celohq/the-future-is-teal-cc264a5d51d3.

To build technology and products that are used and loved by people and solve real-world problems, we need to build a team with many different perspectives and experiences. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply and always consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)celo.org. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible.

About Us

Snapcommerce is a high growth company that sits at the intersection of mobile commerce and fintech. Our flagship product Snaptravel allows millions of users around the world to book their travel over messaging. We are currently in the scale-up phase of the company with plans to grow from ~100 employees to ~300+ employees as fast as possible while maintaining the competitive advantages and culture of being a startup

With a high-performing team of world class leaders, Snapcommerce thrives on tackling complex problems within AI, E-commerce, and Conversational Design to push the boundaries of the value we can add to our user‚Äôs lives!

At Snapcommerce, we pride ourselves on the performance-driven environment we‚Äôve created for our team to prosper and excel. Our values are rooted in making data driven-decisions and risk-taking actions that add value to both the user and the company.

About The Role

We are looking for Software Engineering Intern with 6-18 months of experience to join our growing product engineering team for the Fall term 2021 (September - December) term. Our engineering team is responsible for everything the user interacts with: our chatbot, our frontend, and the services and databases that power these.

Our Tech:
*We use a state of the art architecture powered by services written with Node / Express, Python / Flask, React / Redux, and our proprietary chatbot engine.
*We use Postgres for storage and Redis for caching.
*We use Gitlab for version control and (along with Docker) CI/CD, and our infrastructure is hosted on AWS, making use of Elastic Beanstalk, RDS, etc.
*We invest heavily in monitoring and automated alerting using Datadog.
*We log application-level information using a proprietary logging pipeline, and leverage data analysis using Snowflake.
*We use Amplitude, Hotjar, and LogRocket for client-side metrics and experimentation.

Challenges You'll Solve

  • As a developer on our team you will:
  • Ship high-impact projects end-to-end in a fast-paced, iterative environment
  • Have the opportunity to very meaningfully propel the business forward, and see the impact of your work on the company's business metrics and user experience
  • Own features, services, caches, and databases
  • Be data-driven and close to the customer, running experiments for nearly everything you launch
  • Work in a agile team of 5 engineers with a get-things-done attitude, so you'll have lots of autonomy to create impact while tackling complex technical challenges

About You

  • You have at least 6-18 months of full-stack software development work experience, preferably with exposure to a dynamic, startup environment
  • You learn quickly, regardless of the languages and technologies used
  • You have experience taking ownership and shipping entire features end-to-end
  • You thrive on solving complex problems with logical, well-reasoned solutions

We Believe in Equal Opportunity

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

position: Full Stack Software Developer Intern - Editor Team
description:
Effective visuals and designs give scientists the tools to convey incredibly complex scientific concepts in an unambiguous, universally accessible way. At BioRender, our mission is to empower the world to learn and communicate science faster through visuals. We are passionate about democratizing science communication in order to accelerate scientific discovery.

We‚Äôre looking for a Full Stack Software Developer Intern to join our Editor Team in September 2021! Our stack includes React.js, Node.js, and MongoDB, with a lot of frontend technical challenges. Bonus points if you‚Äôre a fan of drafting/visualization tools or have previous experience working on a similar product!

Our ideal fit

  • Working towards a degree in computer science, computer engineering, or similar
  • Some educational background in mathematics and linear algebra
  • Excellent technical communication skills
  • Ability to explain complex solutions clearly to others
  • Growth mindset, excited to learn new libraries / technologies
  • Extremely curious, creative problem solver

What you'll be doing

  • Identify and build features that are highest impact to our users. Some projects on the roadmap are improving slides functionality, creating drawing tools (shapes, widgets, ‚Äòbio-brushes‚Äô), and improving text functionality.
  • Responsible for the full feature design and implementation: code design, architecture (in collaboration with other team members), implementation, testing, QA, and deployment. You will take on similar projects to a junior full-timer. You‚Äôll be paired with a full-time developer for onboarding, mentorship, and project coordination.
  • Proactively address product issues
  • Conduct peer code reviews, participate in team meetings and contribute to team efforts around code quality improvements

What you bring to the table

  • You have professional experience in our stack (MERN) or extensive web development background and challenging side projects
  • Experience with web-based graphics libraries, mathematics / linear algebra, game development, or animation is a plus (but not necessary for most projects)
  • Must be eligible to work in Canada

About us
BioRender is a software tool that allows scientists to accelerate groundbreaking research across the life sciences by reducing the time it takes to visually communicate research from many hours to just minutes while drastically improving outputs. We aim to save scientists over 1 billion hours of wasted time per year so they can spend it performing life-changing medical research, teaching the scientists of tomorrow, and helping people understand the world around them.

An incredible group of investors back us, including Y Combinator, Refactor and some of the most successful life science entrepreneurs in the world. Our customers range from the world‚Äôs largest pharmaceutical and biotech companies to the most renowned universities and research institutions.

Our tight-knit group is bonded by its shared commitment to our core values of resourcefulness, curiosity, integrity, empathy and humility. By both individually and collectively embodying these values, we can create clean, powerful, elegant solutions that delight our customers.

We are committed to building a warm, inclusive, and diverse environment. We believe that people do their best work when they feel good, and every member of our team deserves to feel safe, empowered, and supported. To this end, we offer a comprehensive set of benefits, including:

Competitive salary
Stock options in a hypergrowth startup - we're growing more than 100% year over year!
Health and dental benefits for you and your family from your first day, including an HSA and extended mental health benefits
Annual professional development budget and regular learning opportunities
3 Recharge Long Weekends per year, in addition to vacation days
Veterinary bill reimbursement program
Regular virtual team events to stay connected
Fast-paced, mission and values-driven environment with highly engaged coworkers

position: Financial Engineering and Data Science Intern

location.city: Los Angeles ‚Ä¢ Santa Monica ‚Ä¢ Los Angeles County

description:
Our new startup, Pace It, is focused on helping retirees convert their hard-earned assets into lifelong paychecks. Millions of baby-boomers are retiring and are facing a tough problem of enjoying their retirement without running out of money. Our digital platform tailors a personalized drawdown strategy for them and assists them to stick by it. By addressing the unique financial circumstances of retirees, PaceIt is poised to become the one-stop solution for all the boomers‚Äô financial needs.

We are four founders with many years of combined experience in the retirement space. We have been helping individuals accumulate for retirement and have realized that there is no good solution to guide them through withdrawals once those individuals retire. We are leveraging our experience and wide network with retirement plan providers and record keepers to distribute our solution. We have already signed a major 401(k) record keeper as our launch partner. We are now focused on building our core team towards a launch of our MVP in 2021. The company is well funded to achieve that goal.

We‚Äôre currently looking for a phenomenal financial engineer with data science capabilities for an unpaid internship starting on June 21, 2021. The internship will allow you to grow and to take part in a multi-disciplinary development effort. Two of the founders are UCLA professors with many years of experience coaching graduate students.

Example of the tasks that you might be asked to complete:
‚Ä¢ Develop Monte Carlo simulations for modeling retirement portfolios.
‚Ä¢ Use machine learning algorithms to improve portfolio modeling.
‚Ä¢ Analyze transaction data and develop algorithms for tracking individuals spending versus their budgets.
‚Ä¢ Develop machine learning algorithm to predict life expectancy and spending patterns of retirees.

Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Previous work in a start-up and/or hi-tech environment is a plus.
‚Ä¢ Experience modeling investment risk and return using Monte Carlo simulations.
‚Ä¢ Experience using statistical computer languages (mostly Python) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, tree-based techniques, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks. Familiarity with Tensor flow and Keras is a plus.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
‚Ä¢ A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
‚Ä¢ Previous experience with cloud technology (AWS in particular) is an advantage.

This is a rare opportunity to take part in a high-growth venture at an early stage and help build a company with an important mission. If you want to do good and do well, help us create a needed financial solution for the many baby boomers retiring every day.

About the Role:

Sezzle currently partners with over 20,000 active merchants to offer their customers the ability to split orders into 4 interest-free payments over 6 weeks. As a Credit Analyst, you will work to ensure that new merchant applications are fully investigated to accurately project the potential monetary risk the accounts pose to Sezzle and take proactive steps to mitigate that risk.

Our Company

Sezzle is a cutting-edge fintech company whose long-standing mission is to financially empower the next generation. Only one in three millennials own a credit card, and the vast majority of millennials possess a subprime credit score or no score at all. To address these problems, Sezzle has built a payment platform that increases purchasing power for consumers by offering interest-free installment plans at online stores. This increase in purchasing power for consumers leads to increased sales and basket sizes for the numerous eCommerce merchants that currently work with Sezzle.

As the first and only B-Corp in the payments space, Sezzle‚Äôs goal is to help everyone pursue financial freedom, and to invest in social good and ethical initiatives that shape a better world.

At Sezzle, we‚Äôre committed to putting purpose alongside profitability. About us & our product:

Sitting at the intersection of art, academia, and technology, Raspberry Dream Labs is a team of artists and engineers drawn together to create innovative multi-sensory solutions for uncensored arts, entertainment and personal intimacy. Over the past 2 years we have organically grown into a community of 5000 supporters, contributors and members and have received overwhelming coverage from the press (BBC, Reuters, Forbes etc.)

We are now working towards the launch of a new product ‚Äì Raspberry Dream Land (RD Land) - social platforms for progressive, uncensored arts & entertainment to facilitate an all-inclusive, and safe virtual space for social interactions and meaningful connections. RD Land is designed to appeal to vast demographics, combat social distancing, humanize VR technology and redefine entertainment.

*The Role: *

Are you eager to build a magical land for the multi-sensory future of XR (Extended Reality)? Then this challenge is for you!

We are looking for a bold, and imaginative developer to join our team and accelerate development of our platform. You will work closely with our senior artists and implement the vision of a brave new world. You will also get an opportunity to fuse your own ideas and creativity in the metaverse of entertainment, relationships and intimacy.

You should have a passion for the entertainment & events industry, future of relationships and intimacy and VR technology.

  • Strong C# object-oriented programming (Mandatory requirement) & scripting language skills
  • Strong 3D math skills
  • Experience working with game assets (meshes, animations, materials etc).
  • Experience profiling and optimizing game and render performance (GPU and CPU)
  • Experience working on a physics-based game project, source control systems such as Git in a multi developer team environment.

Good to have but not essential:

¬∑ Achieved Unity Certification
¬∑ Experience with Photon Unity Networking (PUN)
¬∑ Experience developing applications using RESTful APIs
¬∑ Experience with delivering code for multiplayer games, having shipped at least 1complete multiplayer game
¬∑ Knowledge of professional software engineering practices including unit testing, code reviews, source control management, build processes, continuous integration, and operations
¬∑ Worked as a gameplay programmer on an established team
¬∑ Experience in any XR platforms such as Oculus Rift, HTC Vive, PlayStation VR, or HoloLens
¬∑ Machine learning or experience with algorithm development
¬∑ Experience using JIRA (or other defect tracking tools)

position: Internship Data Scientist / Full stack developer
description:
At Kerberos.io we are building the next generation video management platform or VMS that allow enterprises and end-users to configure their own small or large scale video surveillance/analytics landscape. We work with the latest technologies such as Golang, React, Flutter, Tensorflow, Kubernetes, etc to create a never seen user experience.

Within the Kerberos.io solution stack we have different technologies such as, Kerberos Open Source to support and bring a super cool and affordable VMS to anyone on this planet, and on the other hand Kerberos Enterprise suite which brings through scale and performance for enterprises with an ever growing video landscape.

As a data scientist, full stack engineer/developer you will work within the Kerberos.io ecosystem both supporting end users as enterprise customers by implementing new features, bringing new ideas (we love new ideas and change!). You will leverage all the latest technologies such as Kubernetes, Docker, Golang, React, Tensorflow, etc to create a unique user experience for our customers.

During your internship you will work with highly experienced colleagues (Ex-google, Ex-microsoft, etc), and learn best practices both from coding as presentation skills. We will help you grow and understand how working in a startup environment feels like, and you will have the chance to share new ideas, and implement themself.

About Glooko:

There are over 420 million people in the world with diabetes and Glooko helps them, as well as their physicians and care team, manage the disease more easily and cost effectively. Glooko is the Unified Platform for Diabetes Management and provides an FDA cleared, HIPAA compliant Web and Mobile (iOS and Android) application for people with diabetes and the clinicians who treat them. The platform seamlessly unifies data from over 80 of the leading blood glucose meters, insulin pumps, continuous glucose monitors, activity trackers, and biometric devices to deliver insights that improve personal and clinical decision support.

Glooko‚Äôs mobile app and web dashboard enable patients to easily track and proactively manage all aspects of their diabetes care. Glooko‚Äôs Population Tracker and APIs offer diabetes-centric analytics and supply insightful reports, graphs and pattern-triggered notifications to patients, health systems, and payers. The Glooko platform also allows customers and third-party developers to create branded modules for Glooko users.

Glooko has a global footprint and is funded and managed by visionary technologists and leaders in healthcare.

Glooko provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, or disability. In addition to federal law requirements, Glooko complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Posted positions are not open to third party recruiters/agencies and unsolicited resume submissions will be considered free referrals.

Invitae is dedicated to bringing comprehensive genetic information into mainstream medicine to improve healthcare for billions of people. Our team is driven to make a difference for the patients we serve. We are leading the transformation of the genetics industry by making genetic testing affordable and accessible for everyone to guide health decisions across all stages of life.

POSITION SUMMARY

The Site Reliability Engineer internship position is responsible for a variety of process and infrastructure initiatives, including platform maintenance and enhancements for our flagship cloud-based genomics product, automating existing pipelines to improve efficiency and long-term ecosystem health, performing software updates across our AWS platform, and ensuring that managed assets are performing as expected through the use of telemetry, automated alerts, and self-healing infrastructure.

RESPONSIBILITIES

As an intern, your job duties may involve some or many of the below duties:

  • Ensure that the infrastructure supporting our genomics platform is highly available, scalable, and maintainable
  • Maintain and extend existing configuration management deployments
  • Perform software installations using existing infrastructure and configuration management tools
  • Collaborate with the Cloud Operations team to migrate existing deployment tools into a fully automated and managed process
  • Collaborate with DevOps team to extend and enhance existing CI/CD pipelines
  • Work directly with the DevOps team and software engineers to ensure system integrity
  • Monitor metrics and develop ways to improve telemetry gathering, reporting, and alerting
  • Follow all best practices and procedures as established by company
  • Review, understanding, and compliance with Invitae HIPAA Security policies and procedures
  • Safeguarding the privacy and security of protected health information and European Union personal data
  • Processing and handling of European Union personal data only as directed by Invitae for purposes of personalized molecular pathology

EXPERIENCE

As an intern, you should be familiar with many of the items below, though it is also expected that many of these skills would be developed while serving in this position:

  • Current student in computer science or related field, or equivalent working experience
  • 3 years in an SRE/DevOps role, or related IT or operations field
  • Familiar with Linux and Bash
  • Familiar with configuration management tools (e.g. Salt, Ansible, Chef, Puppet)
  • Familiar with AWS tools and infrastructure (EC2, S3, IAM, ECS, Lambda, and CloudWatch)
  • Familiar with CI/CD tools (e.g. Jenkins), and scripting languages (Python strongly preferred)
  • Familiar with IAC tools such as Terraform (preferred)
  • Familiar with containerized systems in a cloud environment
  • Familiar with Scrum and Agile development methodologies
  • Good interpersonal skills and communication with all levels of management

KEY ATTRIBUTES

  • Drive and determination
  • Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment
  • Ability to participate with others as a member of the team to ensure that demanding and difficult projects are handled smoothly and cooperatively to enhance the success of the projects and maintain strong relationships within all parts of the company
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • Self-starter
  • Driven to perform
  • Able to organize, prioritize, and delegate tasks to efficiently move projects forward

EDUCATION

  • Current student in computer science or related field, or equivalent working experience

description:
Who we are

Whether on the go, in the subway or at home on the sofa, Gabb supports those who enjoy learning at work and school. Since its founding in 2017, the company is growing. In total, Gabb Global offers three learning languages, English, Spanish, and German. Professional courses will be readily available via the Gabb Global website as well as on your smartphone or tablet by the end of this year. Gabb is for businesses, schools, and individual language learners.Help us shape the future of education using or virtual reality language learning experiences. Our mission is to make language education accessible, engaging, and immersive for everyone in the world. From grammar schools in England to public high schools in the US and thousands of total users worldwide, Gabb Global is the most immersive way to learn a language online. As a UX UI designer at Gabb Global, you'll help create and define a cohesive user experience throughout products like Gabb Global, the Gabb Global website, and our apps. You will impact our pilot users by working on real projects while developing your career through hands-on learning and mentorship. You will help design the website that we will use to launch in August of this year.

What you'll do

  • Work on the user experience across multiple Gabb Global products, mobile, and web
  • Work closely with other designers to develop and expand product design patterns
  • Develop both broadly defined, loose concepts, as well as on narrowly defined, tactical features
  • Collaborate on projects with a wide variety of product teams
  • Past Projects include:
  • Stories and Leaderboards on Android
  • Improving and adding components to our design system
  • Adding animated characters to our lessons
  • Launching new courses, like Hindi and Indonesian
  • Improving the UI/UX of the Gabb Global website
  • Designing the experience of Gabb Global Events (online or in-person gatherings)
  • Help engineers and product managers define both the long-term strategy and the short-term tactics for our products
  • Sometimes work on very broadly defined, loose concepts, and sometimes on narrowly defined, tactical features
  • Work in a highly collaborative fashion with the design and product teams
  • Consider all parts of the experience, from copy to animations to business model, when designing

**What we're looking for

  • An online portfolio with mobile app design samples
  • Talent for designing user-centered products that look great too
  • A desire to constantly advance your work and attend to all the details
  • Ability to work remotely
  • Why you'll love working here
  • Collaborating closely with world-class product designers
  • Language learning opportunities**
  • Someone who is looking to grow within the company
  • Someone who loves learning languages

You have
An online portfolio with web or app design samples
Design experience in a consumer application, product, or software role
A desire to keep pushing your work until all details are attended to
The ability to explain your work, process, and decisions and seek feedback to help you produce your best work
The ability to work remotely

Exceptional candidates will have...

2+ years of experience working at a high-paced tech start-up
Experience with illustration or animation (or both)
Experience participating in or leading user research sessions
Loves building language learning products

Whether on the go, in the subway, or at home on the sofa, Gabb supports those who enjoy learning at work and school. Since its founding in 2017, the company is growing. In total, Gabb Global offers three learning languages, English, Spanish, and German. Professional courses will be readily available via the Gabb Global website as well as on your smartphone or tablet by the end of this year. Gabb is for businesses, schools, and individual language learners. Their learning needs, life experiences, and reference points become more varied and colorful by the day, ensuring users see themselves reflected ‚Äînot just in our product but also in the world, allowing them to imagine with us. That means reflecting the dynamism and diversity of our users, as much as possible, in the production of Gabb. We currently have fifteen people from more than six nationalities working in New York, Los Angeles, and D.C., challenging and learning from each other at every step. A culture of difference and dignity is critical to connecting with more users in every hemisphere. As we complete our pilots at universities, we need someone to create fun immersive social media content to provide a refreshing language learning experience to our customers for our launch in 2021. We are looking for a talented Social media intern to join our team and create and maintain a robust online presence for Gabb Global. Your role is to implement online marketing strategies through social media accounts. As a Social media coordinator, you will develop original content and suggest creative ways to attract more customers and promote our brand. Ultimately, you should increase web traffic and customer engagement metrics aligned with broader marketing strategies.

Your Role and Responsibilities

As al Back End Developer Spring/Summer Intern you:

  • Are experienced with client-server architectures, networking protocols, application development, and using databases.
  • Have experience using and developing APIs.
  • Understand user and system requirements
  • Have an understanding of or experience with, Agile development methodology.

What You'll Do:

  • You'll work in a dynamic, collaborative environment to understand requirements, design, code, and test innovative applications, and support those applications for our highly valued customers.
  • Design and code servers, services, applications, and databases that are reusable, scalable, and meet critical architecture goals.
  • Create Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) that are clean, well-documented, and easy to use.
  • Create and configure Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and Software as a Service (SaaS) applications. Design and implement large-scale systems and Service-Oriented Architectures (SOA) that enable continuous delivery.

Who You Are:

  • You are highly motivated and have a passion for creating and supporting great products. Problems, debugging, troubleshooting, designing and implementing solutions to complex technical issues.
  • You have a basic understanding of software development and programming languages.
  • You can learn new skills quickly and use the skills efficiently.

position: ADVISOR - FULL STACK (FRONTEND/BACKEND) PROGRAMMER - Remote Volunteer
description:
ADVISOR ‚Äî Remote Volunteer

ZAKKI is a social startup focusing on creating an inclusive community for the elderly and people with disabilities. Our mission is to facilitate alms and donations collection and distribution to help the elderly and people with disabilities who work in the informal sector to get better livelihood through micro-business management, giving them greater market exposure.

Our Minimum Viable Product (MVP) can be found on https://www.zakki.org.
Currently, we are still redesigning ZAKKI fully function product. We are expecting to develop the ZAKKI fully function product in the upcoming years.

ZAKKI is an online platform-based organization (website and mobile application) that is focused on helping the elderly and people with disabilities get better livelihoods to build inclusive communities in Indonesia. ZAKKI facilitates the collection and distribution of donations to help the elderly and people with disabilities working in the informal sector to obtain better livelihoods through the assistance of micro business management and giving them greater market exposure.

Currently, ZAKKI is developing a ramification project; reporting platforms of sexual misconduct (sexual harassment, sexual assault, rape), human trafficking, and bullying. And we also have an ongoing anti-corruption and a lost-found project. EduGame of anti-discrimination and anti-violence for toddlers to pre-teens. We also have a funeral service project . The volunteer networking and community learning hub. And last but not least, the ZAKKI on the spot marketplace intended to cater to the beneficiaries (the elderly and people with disability) micro-business market exposure.

ZAKKI provides equal volunteering opportunity for everyone regardless of age, sex/gender, color, race, creed, nationality/origin, marital status, sexual orientation, political belief, or disability that does not prohibit essential performance job functions. All matters relating to volunteering are based upon one‚Äôs ability to perform the job, as well as one‚Äôs dedication to ZAKKI‚Äôs Mission and needs.

We are recruiting VOLUNTEER as either DEVELOPER ADVISOR and or PROGRAMMER itself.

The DEVELOPER ADVISOR only required to give advice to the UIUX DESIGNER team concerning the feasibility a feature can be developed. We are not expecting the DEVELOPER ADVISOR to do coding (programming). While for the PROGRAMMER, the volunteer require contributing to the development of the product, means to do coding (programming) the product.

General Requirement:
‚Ä¢ Keen, enjoy, and excited to contribute for social caused and social change.
‚Ä¢ Thinker and Do-er person
‚Ä¢ Abundance with idea and initiative working as a team
‚Ä¢ Active, helpful and collaborative person (not passive person)
‚Ä¢ Good time-management skills
‚Ä¢ Communicative (good communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders)
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in English
‚Ä¢ Have competency to do their chosen role/position
‚Ä¢ Open web standards technologies, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, including jQuery, Vue JS and other libraries,
‚Ä¢ Able to use versioning control system such as GIT, GitLab, SVN

Specific Requirement:
Knowledge of one or more of these skills below:

PWA DEVELOPER :
‚Ä¢ Server-side application development in PHP using frameworks such as Laravel
‚Ä¢ Linux system administration, web server configuration, SQL database (Oracle or MySQL or PostgreSQL), No SQL (Mongo DB) and other common web stack technologies

MOBILE DEVELOPER:
‚Ä¢ Java Programming
‚Ä¢ Hybrid programming for Mobile such as Flutter, Ionic, React Native.

GAME DEVELOPER :
‚Ä¢ OpenGL, Unity 3D, WebGL, and languages such as C, C++, and Java, JavaScript, HTML5, Swift
‚Ä¢ Have competencies and interest in making games (2D/3D) with levelling system, Building Android app, understand iOS is a plus

Interested applicant required to fill up this Google Form.
https://forms.gle/iY7xUbf63QpmdTXb8

Please submit the Google Form with your CV/resume and portfolio URL link (Github/Gitlab).

After the submission, you still able to edit your submitted respond in case you need to update your supporting documents (i.e CV/Resume)

For any further queries related to the volunteering vacancy, feel free to reach us out at hr@zakki.org.

Data is far more useful when you can see it and interact with it. Rose is about creating a home for your data with an end-to-end system that allows you to find, engage with, and share data.

Rose is actively looking for front-end, back-end, and machine Learning interns to help design and build our data platform. Each intern will have a specific pre-assigned project in their chosen field.

For the Frontend position, we are looking for people with experience in D3, React, and data viz principles. The work will involve wireframing new features for our website, improving/replacing our existing UI/UX to help customers learn our tool better, and building new methods to visualize and explore data.

The backend position is perfect for individuals looking for experience in multi-cloud infrastructure, scaling, and optimization problems. You will work directly with a senior infrastructure engineer at Rose.

For the machine learning internship we are looking for folks with some experience/interest in working with medium/large data sets, and running open source machine learning algos to derive conclusions or add structure to data.

Training is significant part of our culture at Rose. We invest significant time developing and training interns.

Our office is in Manhattan, but depending on the candidate, we will consider remote internships as well.

position: Full Stack - Web and App Developer (Web, IOS and Android)
description:
We are looking for a seasoned full stack developer who is well versed in the latest web and mobile technologies and industry trends.

The ideal candidate is a self-starter who has built enterprise software and can drive projects end to end. This individual will be responsible for developing, testing, and debugging responsive web and mobile applications for our company. They will also be involved with management of more junior teammates who will help with development efforts.

The candidate who excels in this position will have the opportunity to grow into a leadership role with our company, potentially into the executive branch.

Responsibilities

  • Translate wireframes into high quality code
  • Write well documented, maintainable, and clean code
  • Ensure best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of application
  • Identify and correct bottlenecks in stack and fix bugs
  • Collaborate with UI/UX team to implement, launch, and iterate MVP solutions
  • Rapid development and automated test processes creation

Skills/Knowledge

  • Experience with iOS and Android Apps
  • Experience with web based apps
  • Ability to build back-end functionality
  • Experience with integration and use of APIs
  • Knowledge of web and mobile technology
  • Experience working remotely
  • At minimum, have knowledge of HTML, CSS, Javascript, React Native, React.js, native IOS and Android - Angular and Responsive Design
  • Familiarity with Agile Development
  • Practical experience in prototyping applications

Preferred Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience in web/app design and implementation
  • Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or equivalent in Computer Science
  • Experience with startups and health sciences industry

Overview:

Potato TV is looking for a web developer intern to help develop the foundation of our social streaming product. The ideal applicant will have a passion for social media, streaming, and connecting people through the TV & movies they love. We are looking for people who want to work on a fun product & who want to make an immediate impact. Successful interns will have an ability to understand our technical approaches, provide innovative solutions, and build efficiently for the future.

Opportunities:

  • Agile development of app features based on customer segment analysis
  • Develop backend functionality & frontend experience for an interactive messaging, video, and audio mobile application
  • Contribute to product design processes (ideation, user journeys, roadmapping, etc‚Ä¶) & learn how they are implemented into product development.
  • Troubleshooting and debugging issues that arise using industry standards
  • Develop, maintain, & update technical documentation for team members
  • Build a social platform experience across mobile & web app surfaces
  • Learn and apply software design and development concepts to our mobile application

About you:

  • Minimum Education: currently enrolled in or have previously completed a BS in computer science. (Currently enrolled in or completed an MS in CS is preferred)
  • Familiarity with front-end development ‚Äì React.js, HTML, CSS and JS
  • Familiarity with using APIs for payments, chat, video streaming, & websockets.
  • Experience working in cloud computing - GCP/firebase & building backend models with noSQL DBs & node JS.
  • Great communication: ability to breakdown technical concepts effectively to non-technical founders
  • Mindset: Human-centered design - Put the user at the center of development
  • Collaborative: With other engineers on projects to seamlessly build a cohesive product using industry standard tools and processes
  • Ability to break down requirements and implement whole features

Commitment:

  • Time: 10-20 hours/week
  • Duration: 10-12 weeks
  • Role: Unpaid internship
  • Location: Remote

Overview

TABS Suite, a Diligence-as-a-Service platform, is a small but powerful team that goes beyond observation and recommendation, focused on helping startups and current / future investors make better business decisions to identify and mitigate issues through our product, the TABS Score (www.tabsscore.com).

We are relentless in uncovering new opportunities to help them achieve greater returns. Our deep knowledge and expertise stem largely from personal experience building independent ventures over the past decade and advising and investing in many across a variety of industries. We value evidence over opinion, and our team of intellectually curious overachievers works tirelessly to provide clear and effective solutions and strategies. As TABS rapidly gains market traction, we are looking for our Spring/Summer '21 software engineering interns to help mold and augment our existing platform.
