Use our quick application form below:

Apply now

Company

Flight Club is revolutionizing the global aviation market by providing pilots and aircraft owners a marketplace through which to buy and sell block time. The functionality is similar to Airbnb and other P2P rental platforms and increases affordability and availability for all market participants.
Flight club is focusing on building an umbrella of services for pilots and aircraft owners to help streamline and automate aviation processes.

Position

This is a unique opportunity to develop a commercial marketplace. The team is led directly by the CEO, with 15 years of experience leading and managing highly skilled teams.
We are looking for a Bubble (https://bubble.io/) developer to add new features to our current platform https://flightclub.life/. Bubble allows quick development of fully functional web applications without writing code.
The main technical skills are familiarity with visual design tools and some familiarity with databases. Bonus points for knowledge of HTML, CSS, and databases. Even more important than the technical skills is critical thinking - we like people that are curious and non-compromising in their quest to understand how systems work.

Skills and Qualifications

  • Ability to design user interfaces
  • Knowledge of at least one programming language (preferably JavaScript)
  • Basic knowledge of HTML and CSS
  • Experience working in a team with tight deadlines
  • Curiosity toward learning new technologies
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Optional: experience testing user interfaces
  • Optional: understanding of REST API

You will use your talents in software development, application architecture, cloud design and deployment to make technology transform the business processes for our customers in industries as diverse as Finance, Public Sector, Retail and Travel and Transport.

You should ideally have strong understanding of the various stacks, libraries, frameworks & languages in back-end and front-end both.

You will be handling our website development work and participate in Hackthons From our side.

What we offer -

Progressive and flexible work hours that matches your personality and lifestyle.
A multicultural and diverse team of colleagues from all over the country that speak on average 3 languages.
The ability for you to make an impact in the emerging fields of Blockchain, cryptocurrency, and decentralized technologies.
We're a contrarian and progressive culture of independent thinkers and systematic executors that are driven to build cool things that matter.

If this aligns with you, time to hop on!

Roles and Responsibility:

You will be working on Making new demo for enterprise use cases.
You will be Helping our developers in Completing Project.
You will be Taking Part in hackathons on Behalf of our company ( Help provided by Developer )

Blockchain Course Certificate
Sholud be able to work with Hyperledger Fabric / Ethereum.
You‚Äôve got good fundamentals of Blockchain as a technology and understand the related aspects.
Sholud be able to work with one of these programming languages Node JS/TypeScript or Java.

Preference:
College degree in Computer Science or IT

position: Blockchain Startup In Pilots Seeks A Google Chrome Extension Developer
description:
* Until we secure revenue or investment unfortunately this is an unpaid local or remote role. *

We believe people should own not only their data, but more importantly the massive value locked away within their reputation they've spent time, money, sweat and tears building on services like Airbnb, Ebay and Facebook.

Reputationaire is a blockchain-enabled platform that allows users to import, store & exchange verified reputation data, to prove their credibility, while optionally remaining anonymous yet trusted - free from age, race, religion and gender biases.


We've in pilots with organisations helping refugees and migrants and IBM have awarded us $220k service credits to help build our blockchain backed tech.

As an early stage award winning, YCombinator Startup School graduate startup with launched MVP we are seeking a web developer to join our team.


Your key responsibilities will be to help with development of a new greenfield Chrome Extension tool to help our users easily verify they own their online public profiles.


What we expect from you
Experienced in Chrome Extensions, HTML, CSS, Javascript (does not have to be employed work experience)
You have a strong results focus, including the ability to set and handle personal goals
You are excellent at presenting information through visual tools and techniques
Ability to challenge the status quo in an appropriate manner
Self-motivated and enthusiasm to learn
Willingness to be the one that always asks ‚Äòwhy‚Äô
Experience working in an agile environment
Superb communication skills, written expression and comprehension
Strong organisation and facilitation skills

Bonus
Example code or projects you've worked on e.g. on Github

description:
Who Are We?

Sanomind is building an audio creator platform for licensed mental health professionals. Think, Patreon for therapists.

We are an open platform where any licensed mental health professional can sign up, create, publish, and earn money from their audio content.

We respect the seriousness of mental health, but we want to make it as fun and cool as going to the gym to work on your physical body.

We're not just another mental health startup, company or directory. We're building a brand and a culture. Not just inside the company, but beyond.

Still with us? Keep reading : )

What's important to us?

We care deeply about the people who are lost and looking for answers. The people who can't afford therapy, but need a little guidance.

We want to help people who can afford therapy find the right therapist.

We care about our partners; the licensed mental health professionals on our platform and the future members.

We're looking for someone that is passionate about using technology for good. You like going in the opposite direction. You don't follow the crowd or what's "in." You start trends and create new lanes. You have ideas and more importantly, you execute on those ideas.

And of course, you are fascinated by the brain and excited about mental health and wellness.

About LocalScale
LocalScale is an organisation focusing on the development of resilient and sustainable local economies through the use of technology, science and regenerative activities.
Our vision is that, given the challenges faced by our civilisation, the depletion of natural resources, and the decline of fossil energies, the transformation of our societies will only be possible through positivist approaches and intrinsically guided by principles of sustainable/regenerative and ethical development of local communities, while respecting and restoring natural ecosystems and promoting diversity and inclusion.
In order to achieve this vision, LocalScale offers an inclusive, free-to-access organisation and a platform that will promote the creation and use of local products, that will provide local economic alternatives to traditional financial systems, that will foster local entrepreneurship and local communities while advocating for social equality and social justice.
LocalScale is based in San Francisco, California, USA.

I won't bore you here with the list of Java skills you need to have for this role: if you're a Java hacker and know the latest tricks on the stack. we're good. Above all our organisation wants to attract individuals who are inspired to change the status quo, who care about the human and natural ecosystems and believe that their action can contribute to change and make a significant impact.

We still have a very small team but a strong supporting community around the world. Our organisation is guided by 3 foundational principles:

*** The Theory of Small Wins: we know that the task before us is massive but we move fast and celebrate every little victory along the way, because every win is part of a more global step in the right direction.
*** The Two Loop Theory of Organizational Change: this theory suggest that change emerges in human systems out of a spontaneous series of local actions, and these local actions spontaneously link together both organically and purposefully in ways that facilitate the development of integrated networks of relationships that are aligned in the pursuit of mutual interests and goals.

  • The Theory Positive Change Cycle: this one refers to the cycle of emotions experienced when someone discovers that important change is upcoming, and demonstrates the importance of being an actor of that change as a way to transform the negative emotions into positive ones.

We're are building a different kind of organisation. If you are interested in discussing, tell us a bit about your experience, about what motivates you and we'll reach out to discuss the opportunity.

About Upped

Upped Events is a SaaS Fintech startup that uses AI-constructed engagements to measure and manage every stakeholder at an event (attendees, staff, managers, vendors, the event owner, sponsors, etc). Using attendee smartphones, Upped‚Äôs software-only infrastructure can scale to any event size, use-case, or format. Real-time event data is combined with external data sources and analyzed by its AI model to maximize engagement opportunities that can be provided to the event owner or each attendee individually. While beta-testing its predecessor‚Äôs mobile payment prototype, Upped achieved ‚Äòaverage attendee spend‚Äô numbers as high as 115% over those attendees without Upped. A prior Wharton Business Plan Competition semi-finalist, Upped was recently designated by Startupbootcamp as a top-20 up-and-coming EvenTech company after winning Cambridge Innovation Center‚Äôs 3675 competition. The company‚Äôs Phase 1 product will be completed by the end of October 2020, during which time the company will be raising investment, growing its management team, and refining its AI offering.

position: Internship in Computer Vision and Deep Learning
description:
Hi,
Are you excited about applying computer vision and deep learning in a variety of
settings?
Are you one who'd like to speed up their exposure to CV & DL?

We are a consultancy that provides modeling and implementation solutions to
students, individuals and organizations. Our services include:

  • doing a survey of methods and implementations to approach a problem. From options on how to model it ( is it a CNN/GAN/VAE? what preprocessing is required? how much time will it take to run?) to figuring out resources ( this blog/github repo has part of the solution, we need to add that part in)
  • customizing solutions for organization's problem (this model was trained on so & so data, we can retrain it for your limited data) , and even providing fixes to existing code (your code is messy, we'll simplify it) and algorithm snippets (stuck on a small subproblem, like scripting for files, preprocessing/postprocessing, we'll handle it).

We are looking for interns to get involved in this high pace and exciting work.
As an intern you will learn to :

  • think on your feet as a CV-DL engineer with new problems and ideas coming up frequently. (expect things to change week to week)
  • understand code quickly, and figure out minimal modifications needed for the situation. (Thinking like an engineer before a scientist)

We are currently solving problems on classification, segmentation, attribute prediction
with new problems on the horizon
Technical Requirements:

  • past exposure to at least 1 of pytorch/tensorflow, with bonus points for both
  • past experience with some Deep Learning in computer vision projects (with github profile)

Soft Skills:

  • professional about scheduling and deadlines.
  • willingness to take instructions and suggestions.
  • communication skills, let us know fast about updates/ restrictions/ issues.

INR 10,000/- per month. Current duration 3 months.

BONUS QUALIFICATIONS

Frontend Software Engineer

About Us

RemNote is the all-in-one workspace for note-taking, learning, organizing thoughts, and growing knowledge. It‚Äôs built for students, creators, organizers, and anyone looking for thinking superpowers.

Thousands of thinkers and learners from around the world trust and rely on RemNote everyday. We're expanding rapidly and just getting started.

As a small team, we're looking for people who are ready to take ownership of projects. We are looking for people who embrace new challenges and never stop learning. Your impact will be visible from day one. You'll work with people who are smart and motivated, but also kind. We expect the same from you.

What You‚Äôll Do

Our product engineers think deeply about the end-user‚Äôs thinking and learning experience. They bring powerful workflows to life through clean, robust, scaleable code.

You will:

  • Work closely with product managers and designers to study user workflows
  • Build features that enhance and fine-tune RemNote‚Äôs core experience
  • Lead engineering projects for significant new initiatives or ‚Äúheadliner‚Äù features
  • Take ownership over significant parts of the codebase, and make careful architectural decisions
  • Write robust, clean code with TypeScript, React, and CSS

What We're Looking For

Technical Background

  • You're experienced with TypeScript, React, and CSS. You know how to architect code in a clean, extensible way.
  • You‚Äôre an experienced web developer and know how to avoid common pitfalls with web technologies.
  • You‚Äôre comfortable with the full spectrum of thinking about a user‚Äôs goals, translating this into workflow specs, and translating workflow specs into code.
  • You're experienced with writing reliable, carefully-tested code.
  • You're comfortable with basic CS principles and especially thinking about graphs.
  • You're comfortable with front-end performance engineering.

Approach

  • Deliberate Problem-solving: You thrive in a scaling startup, can decompose tricky problems, and work intentionally towards a clean solution, by yourself or with teammates.
  • Customer Obsession: You think critically about the implications of what you're building, and how a product‚Äôs design and code affects the experience and life of users.
  • Team player: You work well In a team of diverse skills (design, engineering, product, advocacy). You're able to communicate technical decisions and trade-offs in writing or brainstorming in real time.
  • Fast Learner: You enjoy learning new technologies as you go.
  • Autonomy: You can implement and deliver without a lot of guidance.

Bonus Points

  • You're deeply motivated by the need to build more efficient learning experiences and to support thinkers.
  • You have experience working with cross-platform applications.
  • You're proficient with back-end technology stack: Node.js, MongoDB, and AWS.
  • You deeply understand our product.
  • You've thought deeply about tools for thought and have a vision that aligns with ours.
  • You‚Äôre serious about your own intelligence-augmentation, and have developed workflows that you use to organize your thinking and learning

All of these requirements are not set in stone. We're looking for people who are passionate and ambitious. If you believe you‚Äôre the right person for this job, tell us why.

Is this job not right for you, but you love what we are doing? We have other open positions as well.

Please write a few sentences in your AngelList introduction note about:

  • Why you're interested in RemNote
  • What your ideal role looks like
  • What your ideal timeline looks like ("when can you start?")
  • Anything else you think we should know :)

You will be responsible for managing the interchange of data between the server and the mobile app. Your primary focus will be development of all server-side logic, definition and maintenance of the central database, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. Minimum Qualifications: Must currently be enrolled in a recognized and accredited Canadian post-secondary institution

Why consider Teck Resources Ltd. for your Co-op Placement?
Teck Resources Ltd. is Canada‚Äôs largest diversified resource company committed to responsible mining and mineral development with business units focused on steelmaking coal, copper, zinc and energy. Teck hires more than 150 co-op students each year to work at our various Canadian operations.

We have received several awards and recognitions that are worth noting. Teck was selected as one of Canada‚Äôs Top 100 Employers in both 2018 and 2019, Teck was recognized as one of the Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations in 2019 and in 2018 and Teck was also ranked on the Corporate Knights Best 50 for the 12th straight year based on our dedication to environmental sustainability, and social responsibility.

Ideas at Work & RACE21‚Ñ¢
Digital technologies are transforming our industry and contributing to improvements in every step of the mining process. We enhance our productivity, safety, sustainability, and growth by putting smarter ideas to work and creating advancements in our technology and our practice. At Teck, we don't just embrace ideas, we employ them. We are fostering a culture where employees are encouraged to bring ideas forward, test innovative approaches and implement technologies that can help make us a better company.

RACE21‚Ñ¢ was started in 2019 as an initiative to take a company-wide approach to renewing our technology infrastructure, looking at opportunities for automation and robotics, connecting our data systems to enable broad application of advanced analytics and artificial intelligence, and empowering our employees, with a focus on making real progress between now and 2021. With the expansion in analytics, automation, and digital tools, we are in an era that will lead to a transformation in the mining industry, and you can be a part of it!

Professional benefits of working as a co-op with Teck Resources Ltd:

  • A co-op with Teck will offer you the opportunity to work on challenging projects alongside a team of professionals who are experts in their respective fields, you will experience a combination of projects in the field as well as in the office

Cuberg is commercializing a next-generation lithium metal battery to power the rise of electric mobility. Our battery technology provides huge benefits in terms of energy density, power, and safety, all in a format that allows for rapid scaling. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the future of electric mobility.

We are currently seeking motivated Interns in the areas of materials science, engineering, data, and test. These positions require strong knowledge in chemistry, engineering, data, or science.

We are looking for candidates who have a passion for making an impact in our sustainable energy future and who will thrive in a rapidly evolving, close-knit, and dynamic early-stage startup environment. The ideal candidate will think independently, be unafraid to take on major responsibilities, and perform all tasks with diligence and care.

Join us in building the future of energy.

About

Cuberg is commercializing next-generation battery technology to power the future of electric mobility. The company was acquired in 2021 by Northvolt, a global supplier of sustainable, high-quality battery cells and systems. As Northvolt's Advanced Technology Center operating in Silicon Valley, Cuberg is developing and commercializing lithium metal batteries, building an innovation ecosystem around lithium-ion technology, and leveraging Northvolt's state-of-the-art manufacturing capabilities to rapidly scale up production of advanced batteries.

Responsibilities

  • Work closely with the battery modeling team members

Requirements

  • Currently pursuing a B.S., M.S. or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Material Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Math, Applied Physics, Chemistry, or related area
  • Fundamental knowledge of Li-ion cell electrochemistry and mechanisms
  • Strong background in mathematical modeling and data analysis
  • Excellent communication skills and team-oriented attitude
  • Comfortable with initiating and taking ownership of the projects
  • Advantageous Experience with Python and/or MATLAB
  • Experience in building and maintaining databases

Benefits

Paid time off, holidays

What is Pathrise?
Pathrise (YC W18) is an online program for tech professionals that provides 1-on-1 mentorship, training and advice to help anyone land their next job. On top of that, we're built around aligned incentives. Fellows only pay when they get hired and start working at a job first.

Every day we are expanding our team and our services. We are looking for individuals who are ready to jump into a new role with us. We are a flourishing team and we really enjoy working together to improve our fellows chances of getting the jobs of their dreams! If this sounds like something you'd be interested we‚Äôd like the opportunity to get to know you more.

Our Mission
We seek to uplift job seekers in their careers and help them fulfill their hopes, ambitions, and livelihoods. Read more about why we‚Äôre driven to do this in our manifesto.

The Role
We‚Äôre looking for natural teachers who care about mentorship and uplifting others. As a Data Science Intern, your main responsibility would be to perform admission sessions for our Data track, helping fellows with technical interview prep and from time to time working on internal data projects.

  • 1+ years of experience in data science, technology industry or in a related field
  • Experience with teaching, career advising, and mentorship in education or tech

Pathrise Values...

  • Diversity, equity and inclusion: we value people, opinions and thoughts from diverse backgrounds. Our culture is built upon the pillar of ‚ÄòDEI is not a separate initiative from Pathrise it is a part of Pathrise.‚Äô We invite all to share their stories and we believe that it is through acceptance and curiosity that we can create a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace.

Doris Dev is helping to bring new consumer products to market, from concept to design, engineering, manufacturing, shipping & ongoing operations. Based in New York City & Hong Kong, Doris Dev is working on bringing hardware concepts to market and support operational needs through launch & beyond.

The Team
Since our founding in 2015, Codecov has evolved from a one person team to a distributed remote family. We have team members all across the world and we‚Äôre committed to building disruptive testing tools and code coverage reports that will allow developers to ship healthier code. Similar to the customers we serve, Codecov is a diverse group of curious and creative individuals. Join us on a mission to devise, validate, and oversee the creation of software testing and code coverage products.

The Opportunity
Codecov is searching for an intern to work with our Software Engineering team.

Our engineering team is grouped into three focus areas: The frontend, the core APIs, and the worker. The frontend team is responsible for everything the users sees after they log into codecov (Awesome Dashboards, Insightful Coverage Metrics) The Core API team is in charge of making sure that Codecov reliably handles all API and incoming webhooks requests and the worker team makes sure that all our asynchronous jobs process flawlessly (Calculating Coverage, Setting statuses on the git providers)

The internships focus depends on your interest and you will ship code on products used by over 1M people.

  • Frontend (React.JS)
  • API (Python, Django REST framework, Django, Postgres, Kubernetes, Envoy)
  • Worker (Python, Celery, Postgres, Kubernetes)

Our first data set BreeZo on air quality was recognized and awarded by MIT, Patrick J McGovern foundation, and Schmidt Futures. Our second data set Zuri, for tracking of farm and forest fires, won the Space Oscars. We are also part of the global coalition headed by Al Gore, Climate TRACE, and we are extremely excited that it was recently listed in the TIME Top 100 Innovations of 2020. Our funders include Beenext and Rainmatter.

Over the next 12 months, we aim to expand to 10 environmental data-sets spanning water, land, heat, and more! We are looking to grow our team to power this expansion.

Brief

Blue Sky Analytics is looking for an engineering intern to join its product development team.

We expect you to have beginner-level experience in Javascript, Python, and other language-agnostic principles. You will be responsible for day-to-day bug fixes and feature additions as required. You will communicate well with your manager and understand and execute the scope of your work.

Responsibilities

Our product is going through many iterations and requires a dedicated team to solve issues on developing as they come up.

Keeping this in mind, you will be involved in finishing day-to-day tasks involving coding that focuses on backend, frontend, and cloud - your skills would be required in supporting the entire technical stack.

It is expected that you spend some time upskilling yourself - in regards to the technology being developed for the company.

Requirements

  • Basic proficiency with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
  • Beginner level experience with Node, React, and Python
  • Understanding of Git principles
  • Must have collaborated in a team setup
  • Few starter projects built and deployed e.g. todo-app
  • Must be familiar with basic coding concepts like DRY etc
  • Some knowledge of end to end deployment of applications

Who should apply?

  • You're a self-starter who does not need supervision to get the work done
  • You're not afraid to get your hands dirty with the code - you immerse yourself and find solutions to get the tech working
  • You work to add value to the project and not just spiting code
  • You are looking for a company with deep tech to upskill yourself
  • You are passionate about new tech and can totally geek out on it
  • You have already completed enough starter projects ( for e.g. development of websites, applications)

Note :

  • This is not a summer internship, once you get in you are expected to be a full-time employee after your internship period. If you can't do that because you are still in college or any other reason, you are not eligible for this role.
  • This is not a Data Science role. You will be expected to work on frontend or backend with APIs and UIs and such with minimal use of Python in some cases.

A Little About Us

Our team is founded on four cultural tenets: passion, commitment, energy, and ‚ÄúRisk" . We work in a deeply collaborative and highly efficient manner to allow engineers of any level to make deep, meaningful impact to the product, as well as the business.

A Lot About You

You are a fresher / student yet in the school looking to learn how to build and maintain business critical web applications. As a skilled and passionate intern, you will be working with a strong, cross-functional, and sometimes cross-vertical team of engineers, and will learn how to design and develop applications that enable film makers and music composers create very good music and movie. You will be committed to building fully tested, high quality, and secure applications.

You Are a Good Communicator, Demonstrated In At Least One Of The Following Ways

Technical presentations
Building API backed web applications for projects or internships
Working on team-oriented projects

You are capable of embodying the team‚Äôs cultural values:

Passion for their chosen work (in this case, engineering and learning)
Collaboration as a pattern for problem solving and building consensus
Transparency in the face of ambiguous or difficult situations
‚ÄúGetting stuff done‚Äù through simple, pragmatic iteration and an unwavering focus on product needs

Requirements

You have a passion for your work, the technologies you build, and the people with whom you work.
You are aware/familiar with some Javascript libraries, front-end frameworks, HTML, and CSS , Angular
You are aware/familiar with API frameworks

Job Type: Internship

Required education:
Bachelor's

Create, Collaborate, Monetize your music.

Powered by latest advancements in Audio Engineering, Cloud Computing and Artificial Intelligence,

we aim to build an ecosystem which brings together artists of various domains to find great musicians and music to seamlessly and rapidly create memorable content

About the Role

70Hz is looking for a candidate who is willing to with the Deep Tech Startup to take it to the next level. The candidate must also possess a strong knowledge of web application development using PHP programming language and MySQL Server databases.

Someone who can take ownership of the responsibility and is willing to go that extra mile. Someone who is hungry for knowledge and wants to climb up the ladder quickly.

Key Tasks and Responsibilities

Modifying existing code with new features available in current and future deployments.
Troubleshoot, test and maintain the core product software and databases to ensure strong optimization and functionality.
Understand user requirements and prepare an algorithm.
Write clean, high quality, optimized & reusable code.
Maintain Security of the Application.
Identifies competitive advantages and technological trends for the benefit of a company.

Key Skills

Must be proficient in PHP, Laravel, Mysql, AWS technology stacks.
Must have experience in working on a framework such as Laravel, front-end development skills including Javascript & JQuery.
Experience with REST-based API Development.
Knowledge of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) Concepts, MySQL, CSS3, JSON, XML & MVC.
Knowledge of Networking and Versioning.
Familiarity with SQL/NoSQL databases and their declarative query languages.
Strong programming skills with an understanding of project cycles, development environments, and source control techniques.

Good to Have Skills:

Ability to work without supervision.
Efficiently handles tasks in a reasonable amount of time.
Ability to communicate with clients, colleagues and management to explain complex issues clearly and concisely.
Excellent learner.
Multi-task and manage tasks with varying priorities.

Benefits
Being part of a startup that‚Äôs turning out to be a game-changer, you will be blessed with:

Freedom to try new things.
Take-it-when-you-need-it vacation.
Potential for rapid growth

The Role

We are looking for a new Manager to join our growing team.   • Communicating via phone/email with clients on a regular basis. Strategizing with team members to come up with creative solutions for our clients.
  • Keeping up with the SEO industry through blogs, publishers, competitive research, etc
  • Creating reports to gauge progress and inform the client of the value being provided
  • Presenting your findings to the client in order to influence their onsite content strategy
  • Leading the sales process while calling upon others to assist in solution development and proposal delivery

You Must Have

  • well to do knowledge of website and how to make changes and use different methods to make the product good.
  • 0-4 years experience doing SEO work for clients within an agency environment
  • Proficient with keyword research/data mining tools and competitive analysis
  • Technical knowledge of website architecture (experience with HTML Markup, CSS, XML).
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word, Outlook, and other common applications
  • Experience with content management systems such as Wordpress, Joomla, and Magento
  • High level of comfort using email and the Internet, specifically search engines such as Google, Bing, etc.
  • Ability to quickly pick up new skills and learn new tasks
  • Proven track record of successful project management and multi-tasking skills with the ability to hit and exceed deadlines required
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and oral while paying close attention to details

Hello, we are Atlan! üëã

Our Story: Built for the humans of data, by the humans of data

At Atlan, we started as a data team ourselves tackling problems like national level healthcare and poverty alleviation with data science (TED talk; Case Studies)

The problem: That's how we learn't how tough it was to scale data teams. Data teams are the most interdisciplinary teams ever created: Analysts, Scientists, Engineers, Business; Diverse people with their own tooling preferences and skillsets and "DNA" that need to come together and collaborate effectively. Leading to collaboration chaos.

We would be awoken with crisis calls every second day for the minutest of issues - from troubleshooting why number on a dashboard is incorrect to getting access to the right dataset! Atlan started as us building small tools to make our own data team more agile.

Over a couple of years, we made our team 6X more agile and went on to do amazing things like build India's National Data Platform used by its Prime Minister. (data for 500M citizens, built by an 8 member team, fastest project of its kind to go live ‚Äî in 12 months instead of projected 3 years)

üí° Could the tooling we built for ourselves help data teams around the world? That's how Atlan was born. We're on the mission to help data teams around the world do their lives' best work.

Read our cofounder, Prukalpa's article about our vision for the future of data collaboration and our journey of failing 3 times before we figured out the real solution.

description:
BeSingular is a unique learning platform to educate and empower the next generation to create a real and responsible impact in the world by working with the technology of the future.
The innovative and well researched curriculum imparts skill sets based on Exponential Technologies which will benefit them in every aspect of their lives.

Want a role where you are impacting and changing education each day?

Our vision is to give every student access to high-quality, engaging, radical and outcome-driven Curriculum and instructions
no matter their zip code.

Requirements:

  1. Working Experience On One or More Of The Following: a) Virtual Reality/Augmented Reality (Experience in UNITY 3D) b) Flutter/React Native (Experience in publishing the App to IoS or Android Store) c) 3D Modelling (CAD Experience Required) d) Game Design 2D & 3D (JavaScript Experience Must) e) IoT Experience (Working Experience on Raspberry Pi and understanding of MQTT/HTTPS is required) f) Robots Simulator (https://cyberbotics.com/) g) Website Design (Experience on HTML/CSS) h) Design Thinking (Online course or degree in design thinking)

What will you do:

  1. Work with our content developement team to create training program coordination and management
  2. Map out training plans, design and develop training programs as per BeSingular Methodology and Pedagogy
  3. Designing course materials/programs/codes and other documents such as handouts, manuals, and exercises.
  4. Develop and implement lesson plans in alignment with session
  5. Define student workflow, establish metrics, deliverables, and other processes for measuring program progress.
  6. Design detailed training curriculum, including age group, dates/frequency, topics and number of hours required per course
  7. Set learning objectives for each course
  8. Creating supplementary teacher and student guides, as well as resource packs
  9. Determine evaluation criteria for during session and after session of learning outcomes

INTERNSHIP PERIOD: 2 MONTH, 4 MONTH and 6 MONTH (Depending On Experience)
FULL TIME OPPORTUNITY: As soon as completion of INTERNSHIP

Working Location: Gurugram
Working Hours: 08:30 AM to 5:15 PM
Working Culture: Mix of On Site and W.F.H (On Site Presence Will Be Must For Few Days In A Week)
Compensation: W.FH (UnPaid) and Physical Internship (As Per Policies)

MENTION THE FIELD YOU ARE INTERESTED FOR

üíò Our Mission

Shinkei Systems builds robotics that multiply the shelf-life of wild caught fish.

With only 1 in every 3 fish caught making it to a plate, the fishing industry has numerous waste problems to solve from both tails of the operational chain that could save billions.

Spun out from researchers at Carnegie Mellon School of Computer Science, Shinkei uses computer vision and robotics to redefine how we treat the animals we catch and eat. We are experienced moonshot prototypers and have exhibited design work internationally at top venues. Our board has professors from the top robotics schools in the world and experienced founders in the area.

We are looking for energetic folks to join our team who are excited to create technology that transforms the world at scale.

üëÄ The Opportunity

Ever wonder why we pay a premium for sushi?

Why confined, farmed fish are the standard in supermarkets?

How large legacy industries operationally tick?

Shinkei is looking for mechanical engineers for a paid opportunity over the summer to work on transforming society‚Äôs relationship with an animal that feeds billions of mouths annually. We‚Äôre on the lookout for people who love to get their hands dirty building working prototypes for moonshot ideas and who can take responsibility meeting deadlines over extended project timelines.

You won't be limited to clinking metal ‚Äî we believe engineers should be involved in company strategy, product direction, and anything else you might be interested in.

What You Get To Do:

  • Design real robotics solutions to solve major humanitarian concerns
  • Utilize mechanical engineering tools by building a product end-to-end
  • Work autonomously in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment from either New York or Philadelphia
  • Unrestricted access to a makerspace
  • Talk to real customers for user research on design
  • Set the foundation for our engineering culture
  • Travel to Maryland to try out traditional techniques aboard industrial boats
  • Have a hand in transforming our relationship with our food

What You Need:

  • An innovative mind with a practical bend and an interest in changing the way we consume our food
  • Pursuing bachelors or masters in Mechanical Engineering, Robotics, similar field or sufficient previous experience
  • Background (portfolio, side projects, coursework) in physical prototyping, gantry design and misc. mechanical engineering projects
  • Basic abilities with mechanical design tools (SolidWorks, FEA, drawings and documentation)
  • Capable of researching, designing and testing using rapid prototyping techniques
  • Experience with lab testing and fabrication equipment
  • Familiarity with common manufacturing processes a plus
  • Exposure and interest to robotics or embedded systems a strong plus

Software Engineering Intern (Summer 2021)

Roblox is ushering in the next generation of entertainment, allowing people to imagine, create, and play together in immersive, user-generated worlds. We‚Äôre the one and only fastest-growing entertainment platform that lets anyone teach themselves how to code, publish, and monetize any experience imaginable‚Äîacross any device‚Äîreaching over 100 million players across the globe every month!

The impact that you can have at Roblox is powerful. We‚Äôre looking for someone who‚Äôs eager to take on a meaningful role in the success of Roblox on a massive scale. Someone who takes play seriously, but also isn‚Äôt afraid to have some fun either. Someone who‚Äôs ready to take Roblox‚Äîand their career‚Äîto the next level.

In 2020, we were honored to be one of the Top 100 Internship Programs in the US. In 2019, we were honored to be recognized as a Certified Great Place to Work¬Æ. We‚Äôve fostered a company culture that empowers people to do the most defining work of their career in an environment that‚Äôs made up of the most passionate, team-oriented, visionary, crazy-smart people you‚Äôll ever meet. Join the Roblox team where play rules and the possibilities are endless.

Work with the most passionate, team-oriented, visionary, and crazy-smart people you‚Äôll ever meet. The engineers at Roblox are working on the hardest problems in tech today -- distributed systems, real time communication, 3D co-experience, massive data processing, social networking, rendering, physics, and more. As an Engineering Intern, you will have real ownership and impact across one or more of these domains.

You Are:

  • Pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science or similar technical degree or you are a veteran with years of experience developing Roblox games and are familiar with software engineering from school, internships, personal projects, or previous jobs
  • Adaptable and able to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
  • Working towards mastery of one or more programming languages such as Go, Node.js, Ruby, Python, C++, Lua, Swift, C# or Java.
  • Eager to Learn industry-leading frameworks and libraries.
  • Passionate about games, community driven content generation, and social networking.
  • Tenacious about learning and creating great experiences as you work hard with your team to reach collective goals.

You Will:

  • Be embedded into a software engineering team with responsibility and deliverables
  • Regularly ship code to production
  • Own a summer internship project and present it to Roblox leadership
  • Work collaboratively with Roblox‚Äôs design, product, data, QA, and DevOps teams.
  • Gain valuable and marketable experience helping to build one of the fastest growing software platforms in Silicon Valley

description:

  • Work and collaborate with insurance product team, UI engineers and data science, machine learning team.
  • Actively participate in a highly collaborative agile development process to achieve cost, quality and delivery objectives.
  • Continuously deploy software in containerized micro-services running on public cloud infrastructure.

Nice to have:

  • Experience working on Software as a Service products.
  • Experience with Kafka.
  • Experience building cloud-based RESTful applications with JSON, and an aptitude for best practices in designing RESTful APIs.
  • Experience with continuous integration and automated testing.

Interested in working on hard problems at scale?

We are looking for current and graduating MSc/PhD students who would like to work with us on a research project. You should have some prior practical industry experience, strong coding and software engineering skills, as well as a publications in relevant CV/ML conferences or journals.

IMI builds ML products and services used by some of the largest companies in the world. Come learn from our veteran team of machine learning and distributed systems experts, hailing from Stanford, MIT, Apple, and Cloudera.

We are now opening applications for our 2020 ML Fellows/Interns program. You will be expected to work remotely: we have a large distributed workforce working alongside the teams in our San Francisco, Berlin, or Helsinki centers, and we are highly comfortable with remote collaboration.

We conduct original research in areas like unsupervised and active learning, motivated by the unique problems and datasets we have access to as one of the larger users of cloud resources for ML.

You will have the opportunity to publish with our scientists if your work yields results, and we have a strong commitment to open source code and (when possible) datasets.

Research interests:
A background in representation learning, theoretical computer vision, or statistical physics will be helpful, as well as applied applications of Deep Learning to Computer Vision problems.

Current areas of interest include Active Learning, Self- and Semi-supervised learning, Uncertainty Estimation (Bayesian Neural Networks), Anomaly detection, Deep Hashing for Image Retrieval, Weak Supervision, Zero-shot learning, Domain Adaptation, Meta-Learning.

Functional skills:
We work primarily in Python for research, with pyTorch and Tensorflow being our preferred tools. You will have access to our in-house distributed training and inference infrastructure, which has been designed for ease of use but still benefits from basic knowledge of distributed systems.
Experience with cloud-based training and dealing with preprocessing huge datasets is beneficial.

We also strive for a high degree of programming competence within our research group, as we have found that good discipline in implementing ideas makes your task easier and collaboration more pleasant. If you are one of the many excellent researchers who have never written a unit test this will likely change.

Please send your CV, github, and a brief description of what most interests you, along with your dates of availability and preferred location.

IMI does not discriminate on the basis of race, creed, color, ethnicity, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression, age, height, weight, physical or mental ability, veteran status, military obligations, or marital status.

Quantcast is hiring Software Engineering Interns to join our engineering teams in our San Francisco office.
As the real-time pulse of the Internet, Quantcast runs the world‚Äôs largest AI-driven insights and measurement platform directly quantifying over 100 million web destinations. Using machine learning to drive human learning, Quantcast provides brand marketers and publishers with meaningful audience insights, predictive targeting and measurement solutions across the customer journey.
As a part of the Software Engineering Internship program, you will lead a specialized project while having the mentorship of Engineers from different technical backgrounds. These Engineers have a real passion for technology, solving significant problems, and want to make a tangible impact.
You‚Äôll have the opportunity to learn software engineering best practices and own projects from start to finish with teams that specialize in machine Learning, distributed storage systems, big data platforms, API development and data visualization.

Responsibilites

  • Our unique 10 to 12 weeks summer internship program provides you with a comprehensive introduction to the ad tech industry while being fully integrated into a team
  • You will have full project ownership and the autonomy to build impactful products. At the end of your internship, you will present your project to the entire engineering organization
  • We will pair you with a dedicated mentor on your team to ensure the success of your project. They will be your go-to person for any questions, suggestions, advice, and educational feedback
  • You will engage with executives and industry leaders through intern and company wide events. We believe in order to grow and be successful having access to all resources is key!
  • You will participate in fun and memorable events with fellow interns, mentors, and full-timers. Past events have included Cable Car Trolley Tours, volunteering, CAL Academy, scavenger hunts, and Giants games. While we do work hard we love to have fun!
  • We offer perks, which include intern housing stipend, snacks and drinks, catered lunches, dinners & weekly happy hours

Requirements

  • Excellent command of one or more programming languages: Java, C++ or Python
  • Deep understanding of algorithms and data structures
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Pursuing a BS, MS or PhD degree in Computer Science or related field
  • Graduation date between Dec 2020 and June 2022

About Anyscale:
Anyscale provides an application development platform for developers to build distributed applications. We‚Äôre commercializing a popular open source project called Ray, which is a framework for distributed computing as well as an ecosystem of libraries for scalable machine learning. Our goal is to build a standardized platform for distributed computing. Ray was developed at UC Berkeley by Robert Nishihara and Philipp Moritz, under the guidance of Ion Stoica and Michael Jordan, and the four of them have co-founded Anyscale. The company raised a $20.6M Series A and a $40M Series B funding from Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), NEA, Foundation Capital, Intel Capital, Ant Financial, Amplify Partners, 11.2 Capital, and The House Fund.

With Ray, we're making it easy to program at any scale (from your laptop to the datacenter) by providing easy-to-use, general-purpose, and high-performance tools. In addition, we are building a rich ecosystem of libraries (for reinforcement learning, hyperparameter search, experiment management, machine learning training, prediction serving, and more) on top of the core distributed system so that users can rapidly build sophisticated applications. Help us build the future of software development.

We are looking for passionate, motivated people who are excited to build tools to power the next generation of cloud applications.

We are hiring strong software engineer interns for a variety of roles. Examples include:

Distributed systems
Machine learning
Frontend
Observability
Production serving
Ecosystem
C++
Reinforcement Learning

As part of your role you will:

  • Develop high quality software to empower software developers and simplify programming
  • Work with a team of leading distributed systems and machine learning experts
  • Communicate your work to a broader audience through talks, tutorials, and blog posts
  • Help us to build and shape a world class company

As a QA Intern, you‚Äôll help launch new features and fixes to our product line. You‚Äôll work closely with developers, product managers, and user experience designers to help facilitate high-quality production releases. Our interns are a fully integrated member of a scrum team while having the support of the entire QA team if workload becomes overwhelming, or if you need a second set of eyes for troubleshooting. As a team, we believe our time is best spent testing, so we don't spend a lot of time writing test plans which allows us to act swiftly and better streamline our internal operations. As a QA Intern you‚Äôll have a high level of autonomy and a self starter attitude is crucial. Your typical day-to day responsibilities will include stand-up meetings, reviewing pull requests, and testing new functionalities using the Session Based Testing approach. You‚Äôll also have weekly 1:1 meetings to facilitate an open discussion with your manager about your current needs and long term career goals.

Our mission is to empower people to see and understand how their business works, so they can innovate faster. And we hold true to our core values of: (1) innovation in everything we do; (2) passion & excellence in every area; (3) providing individual empowerment, initiative and ownership; and (4) teamwork over ego.

  • Driven to meet Lucid's Core Values of Innovation, Passion & Excellence, Empowerment & Initiative and Teamwork over ego

Preferred Qualifications

  • High academic performance
  • Genuine enjoyment of software quality assurance work
  • Desire to be on a highly productive, fast-paced team
  • Experience with web application testing
  • Experience with development and execution of test suites

We are seeking a QA Intern to join our team in April/May 2020. This individual will help us complete major releases to our product line during the summer of 2020.

If you are a great engineer and want to get into blockchain space, this position is a perfect step for you.

When you think about your last doctor‚Äôs appointment, how much do you actually recall? If you‚Äôre like most people, you‚Äôll likely forget over 40% of the conversation. Details fall through the cracks, generic printouts you receive end up in the trash, and important information never makes it to other doctors. Ultimately, you‚Äôre left needing to connect the dots in your care. That‚Äôs why we started Abridge with a simple thesis: if we can shift agency to consumers, we can help them stay on top of their health. When you use Abridge to record your health conversations, the conversations themselves become your medical record. It‚Äôs as easy as that.

We are looking for research interns to working on exciting NLP challenges using our large annotated proprietary healthcare datasets. You will be able to create/customize your internship research statement and collaborate with our in-house Machine Learning research team. At the end of the internship, you will also have the opportunity to publish your work at top tier conferences such as NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, NAACL, and ACL.

The goal of the internship is to advance the state-of-the-art in one or many of the following research areas:

  • Dialog Understanding
  • Sequence-to-Sequence Modeling
  • Clinical Natural Language Processing
  • Information Extraction
  • Machine Learning using Ontologies or Knowledge graphs

Required Qualification:

  • Must be accepted to or currently enrolled in an MS or Ph.D. program in Computer Science or a related field
  • Must have at least one NLP machine learning paper submitted or published
  • Experience in utilizing theoretical and empirical research to solve problems
  • Ability to communicate complex research ideas in a clear, precise, and actionable manner

*Research internships are offered year-round with flexible durations

Compensation

  • $80,000-$100,000 per year

Life at Abridge

At Abridge, we‚Äôre driven by our mission to bring understanding and follow-through to every medical conversation. Our culture is founded on doing things the ‚Äúinverse‚Äù way in a legacy system‚Äîfocusing on patients, instead of the system; focusing on outcomes, instead of billing; and focusing on the end-user experience, instead of a hospital administrator's mandate.

Abridgers are engineers, scientists, designers, and health policy experts from a diverse set of backgrounds‚Äîan experiment in alchemy that helps us transform an industry dominated by EHRs and enterprise into a consumer-driven experience, one recording at a time. We believe in strong ideas, loosely held, and place a high premium on a growth mindset. We push each other to grow and expose each other to the latest in our respective fields. Whether it‚Äôs holding a PhD-level deep dive into understanding fairness and underlying bias in machine learning models, debating the merits of a Scandinavian design philosophy in our UI/UX, or writing responses for Medicare rules to influence U.S. health policy, we prioritize sharing our findings across the team and believe that "you need to taste good things to have good taste."

Abridge is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusion is at the core of what we do. We actively welcome applicants from all backgrounds (including but not limited to race, gender, educational background, and sexual orientation).

position: Data Science Intern, Decision Science (Fall 2021) - Canada
description:
Coursera was launched in 2012 by two Stanford Computer Science professors, Andrew Ng and Daphne Koller, with a mission to provide universal access to world-class learning. It is now one of the largest online learning platforms in the world, with 82 million registered learners as of March 31, 2021. Coursera partners with over 200 leading university and industry partners to offer a broad catalog of content and credentials, including Guided Projects, courses, Specializations, certificates, and bachelor‚Äôs and master‚Äôs degrees. More than 6,000 institutions have used Coursera to upskill and reskill their employees, citizens, and students, including in high-demand fields such as data science, technology, and business. Coursera became a B Corp in February 2021.

At Coursera, our Data Science team is helping to build the future of education through data-driven decision making and data-powered products. We drive product and business strategy through measurement, experimentation, and causal inference. We define, develop, and launch the models and algorithms that power content discovery, personalized learning, and machine-assisted teaching and grading. We believe the next generation of teaching and learning should be personalized, accessible, and efficient. With our scale, data, technology, and talent, Coursera and its Data Science team are positioned to make that vision a reality.

We are looking for a creative and collaborative Data Science intern to accelerate decision science at Coursera. During this full-time 16-week internship program, you will be embedded as a full-time member of our Data Science team and paired with a mentor. You will work on real features and build internal tools that inform our decision about how best to serve our 68+ million learners worldwide!

This internship will run from August 30 - December 17. It will be fully remote, but you will need to work remotely from one of the following Canadian provinces: Ontario, British Columbia, Alberta, Manitoba, New Brunswick, Newfoundland and Labrador, Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island, or Saskatchewan. We will begin reviewing applications on May 24.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and share internal reporting for Data Scientists and Product Managers to better understand how learners are interacting with our product
  • Collaborate with Product Managers, Designers, and other Data Scientists to identify opportunities to improve learner experiences on Coursera
  • Design and analyze experiments that will evaluate new features and inform product direction
  • Distill insights from complex data, communicating findings to technical and non-technical audiences

Basic Qualifications:

  • Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or related field (recent graduates also welcome to apply)
  • Experience with relational databases and SQL for data retrieval

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with at least one scripting language (e.g. Python)
  • Experience with at least one statistical software package (e.g. R, NumPy/SciPy/Pandas)
  • Experience with explaining technical concepts to non-technical audiences
  • Experience with designing clear and informative data visualizations
  • Project management and cross-functional collaboration skills

If this opportunity interests you, you might like these courses on Coursera:

  • Marketing Analytics
  • Data-Driven Decision Making

Coursera is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected class.

If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, please contact us at accommodations@coursera.org.

Please review our CCPA Applicant Notice here.

ABOUT US
At ZaiNar, we‚Äôre leveraging patented innovations using software-defined radios and advanced signal processing to build revolutionary new products in Positioning, Navigation, and Timing. Our imaginative team has developed the world‚Äôs most precise network time synchronization and distribution capabilities ‚Äì wirelessly syncing to sub-nanosecond accuracy. We‚Äôre solving leading edge problems in RF location tracking and network communications. Our initial target market is asset tracking in dynamic industrial environments ($10B+), and the opportunities beyond that are endless. ZaiNar already complies with release 16 of 3GPP standards for 5G, to enable ZaiNar location tracking for any 5G-NR device without hardware changes. ZaiNar is VC-backed by tier 1 funds including Softbank, and has graduated from multiple accelerator programs including StartX, Alchemist, and Plug and Play.

Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace, where the best idea wins, is important to us. So, come join a curious, collaborative, and forward-thinking team, where everyone has the freedom to shape their own future, our company‚Äòs, and the world‚Äôs ‚Äì one nanosecond at a time.

THE ROLE
Join a team of brilliant engineers developing the next generation of networked software-defined radio systems to support ZaiNar‚Äôs super-precise network time distribution capabilities. We are seeking an Engineering Intern for Summer 2021. ZaiNar is looking for highly motivated software interns to be a part of a star team. Our company is seeking self-starters who are interested in owning real engineering projects during their internship. ZaiNar Engineering is in an important phase of product development, and there are many interesting projects. A well-matched intern will bring excitement, curiosity, and flexibility to the role.

We are prepared for, and flexible with, working from home. Due to the pandemic, the role will be partially or fully remote, but we do have an office in downtown Redwood City, CA that is open with strict safety guidelines in place and in compliance with all the current local, state, and CDC regulations.

COMPELLING ATTRIBUTES
‚óè Studying computer science, EE, or related fields towards a post-graduate degree (PhD preferred)
‚óè Strong data analytics, signal processing and/or wireless communication background
‚óè Familiarity with super-resolution algorithms for angle of arrival estimation
‚óè Background in estimation theory and statistical signal processing
‚óè Solid knowledge of convex and non-convex optimization techniques
‚óè Experience with Python, C++, and comparable programming languages

‚óè Ability to be a self-starter and solve problems proactively
‚óè Excited about working in an agile, startup work environment

ALSO INTERESTING

Starfish Space is a space startup in Kent Washington founded by former Blue Origin and NASA engineers. We are giving life to on-orbit services with our Otter Space Tug and satellite servicing technologies.

Position Description
Rendezvous, Proximity Operations, and Docking (RPOD) is an essential phase of any satellite servicing mission. Starfish Space is developing CEPHALOPOD, RPOD software that is capable of docking with efficient electric propulsion. This position will support the development of that technology, and relies heavily on astrodynamics and guidance navigation and control skills. The engineer will do everything ranging from developing GNC algorithms, to refining concepts of operation, to running simulation analysis.

Qualifications

  • Must be a US person (citizen or permanent resident)
  • Willing to work from Kent, Washington
  • Engineering or sciences education or experience
  • Capable of working a dynamic, fast paced startup environment
  • Software and/or computer programming capability

Desired Experience

  • B.S. degree or equivalent in Aerospace Engineering or similar field
  • Programming experience in Python and/or C
  • Working knowledge of Astrodynamics
  • Working knowledge of rendezvous, proximity operations, and docking techniques
  • Working knowledge of numerical techniques such as optimization and/or machine learning

Starfish Space is a space startup in Kent Washington founded by former Blue Origin and NASA engineers. We are giving life to on-orbit services with our Otter Space Tug and satellite servicing technologies.

Position Description
Satellite servicing missions require autonomous, robotic actions in orbit. To fulfill our mission Starfish is developing the Otter space tug and the Nautilus capture mechanism to interact with and maximize the operational value of satellites. This position will support the development of that technology, and relies heavily on mechanical engineering, electromechanical prototyping, and system design skills. The engineer will do everything ranging from designing in CAD, to manufacturing prototypes, to designing and executing a test plan.

Qualifications

  • Must be a US person (citizen or permanent resident)
  • Willing to work from Kent, Washington
  • Engineering or sciences education or experience
  • Capable of working a dynamic, fast paced startup environment
  • Mechanical and/or electrical prototyping capability

Desired Experience

  • B.S. degree or equivalent in Aerospace Engineering or similar field
  • Previous experience designing and/or prototyping space systems
  • Programming experience in Python and/or C
  • Working knowledge of mechanical engineering
  • Working knowledge of electrical engineering

White Fox Scooters is the first docked electric scooter solution for walkable cities and micro-communities. Our docks have been initially deployed and hosted through partnerships with local governments as well as local businesses such as hotels, parking garages, and apartment buildings. We‚Äôre taking the electric scooter sharing model to the streets of New Jersey, hopefully New York soon, (as well as all other walkable cities) since we truly believe it is the most fun and efficient way to get around. We disrupt the electric scooter sharing industry in a key way: we place a strong emphasis on public safety. Our docks keep the scooters out of the path of pedestrians and allow us to share helmets with our riders. The company is led by our founder, Sidd Saxena, who has had prior experience in technology investment banking, ran multiple profitable businesses, and leads the YPO YNG Initiative in New York City.

Interns at White Fox Scooters will have the opportunity to make an impact in a way they never have before. Because of our small team, you will be able to interact and share ideas with all members, ask for feedback, and develop yourself as much as you develop the organization.

White Fox Scooters is looking for someone with experience in backend development. We are looking for a candidate who can create and manage databases for our users and/or scooters. You will be working with Electrical and Computer Engineering Interns who are currently designing the hardware and software running within our docks and scooters to build smart docking station with automated locking and charging features. Docking station and scooters, both will have unique id and several methods defined in computer of docking station. When the scooters are docked or undocked, the database must be updated to reflect who is using which scooter and at which docking station a scooter is located. Interns must be available a minimum of 20 hours/week. Course credit available.

Requirements:

> Currently pursuing a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a related field, or graduated with a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a related field within the last 6 months (Master‚Äôs level preferred)
> Strong background in computer programming
> Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google Suite
> Strong attention to detail
> Creative problem-solving skills
> Competence in research skills
> Strong written and oral communication skills in English
> Demonstrated experience with database creation or management
> Has knowledge of a web framework or a mobile development framework
> Project experinece with Django,Flask webdevelopment framework required.
> Other Experience: Postman, JWT, JSON, HTTPS Required.
> Has experience integrating different API's, REST API preferred.

Experience with these is a plus, but not required:

>Basic knowledge of hardware and embedded software systems
>Testing and certification of electrical systems
>Python
>Raspberry Pi

We are a software company. Code is what we live and breathe.

From the frontend to the backend, we have innovated on all parts of the iOS stack:

  • SwiftUI - Apple's latest UI toolkit that allows for efficient UI development
  • Kotlin Multiplatform - A shared backend with a best-in-class integration experience, even for iOS
  • Firebase, SQLDelight and Coroutines - Tooling that makes backend endpoints simple

We don't expect you to know any parts of our iOS stack, after all these tools are incredibly new. However, we expect you to be excited about learning and developing with the coolest iOS stack!

YokD is going to revolutionize the fitness industry. If you have a goal of getting fit or healthy, you‚Äôve surely faced the dilemma of a lack of reliable options to turn to. Personal trainers are too expensive with no quality assurance, with manipulative contracts. Workout buddies drop out after a while, as they‚Äôre unmotivated also.

YoKD plans to offer the widest selection of fitness experts ready to help our users with a variety of services. Our team is really looking to change the outdated fitness game, so we are looking for passionate, energetic and fun individuals.

....

About Lunchclub

At Lunchclub we're helping people relevantly grow their professional network. We use AI to scale data-driven matches to thousands of people weekly, small groups of like-minded individuals, and panels with some of the world's best. We've introduced people who have started companies together, received/given mentorship, received funding, made their next hire, or friend. We're a small, tight-knit, but distributed team, powering connections in and between 57 cities across 6 continents.

About engineering at Lunchclub

We're a small team of generalist software engineers driving big outcomes with a lot of shared responsibility. We often work outside the traditional Fullstack/Backend/Frontend mould to create, fix, and improve Lunchclub for our users and fellow engineers. Our engineers also actively take part in discussions on product, design, user interviews, and more. The fastest way to learn technology is to build things at an early stage startup ‚Äî we expect you to grow a lot as an engineer during your time here.

About the role

As a software engineer intern at Lunchclub you'll...

Build features from start to finish. Start with research or an idea, work with design to draft up a spec, build, launch, and polish.
Improve and iterate on existing features through A/B testing, user, or team feedback.
Build and improve existing internal tools, helping us maintain our team's high impact on our growing community.
Play an active role in the shaping of the future of the product and business.

This role could be for you if...

You love problem solving ‚Äî especially with code.
You're looking to grow quickly as an engineer and do not fear ownership, even at an early stage of your career.
You know how to balance building quickly with building well.

Bonus: You're adept with Javascript/React, Python/Flask, MySQL, Docker.

Benefits

Flexible vacation time.
Hybrid remote/office work culture.

Lunchclub is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. description:
Location: At the moment, we are all working remotely. However, our headquarters are in New York, and this position will be based in NYC once we are back to working in-person.

About OpenFin

OpenFin is a fast-growing financial technology company backed by the world‚Äôs largest banks and most respected Fintech VCs, including J.P. Morgan, Barclays, HSBC, Wells Fargo, SC Ventures, Bain Capital Ventures, DRW, Nyca Partners, and Pivot Investment Partners. OpenFin modernizes and democratizes app development and distribution in the finance space. We provide a secure OS that brings a fast and intuitive app experience to the financial desktop. Built on Google‚Äôs Chromium and GitHub‚Äôs Electron open source projects, OpenFin combines native experience, data sharing, lightning-fast distribution, and robust security with an agile web development and deployment model to accelerate digital transformation and innovation. OpenFin is used by thousands of developers to deploy and run more than 1200 apps at more than 1500 financial institutions.

About the Role

We are looking for a frontend engineer to join our Product Engineering team who is excited about learning new languages, frameworks and technologies.

Responsibilities

Work covers a range of interests and areas of expertise that can scale to what you would like to learn! The following are three area

  • Contribute to the OpenFin UI Library‚Äîarchitect and build accessible, extensible, and well-tested React components used in several OpenFin products shipping this year.
  • Help shape the OpenFin Developer Experience‚Äîbuild out automation and testing, documentation, prototypes, and give tech talks. Help optimize and build engineering processes and community knowledge product engineering teams working with the UI Library.
  • Contribute to building new features‚Äîdeliver a best-in-class user experience in OpenFin products.

What We‚Äôre Looking For

  • A user-focused, empathetic person who wants to collaborate, write, talk, and dream about code that people will love to use.
  • Comfortable building React components and a passion for making them pixel perfect.
  • Awareness of accessibility best practices, progressive enhancement, the DOM / Shadow DOM and how React ‚Äúworks‚Äù under the hood.
  • Familiarity and an interest in using Typescript, Styled Components, and Framer Motion.
  • An interest in learning cross-platform development for Mac and Windows using Electron and modern tools and frameworks like Webpack and NextJS.
  • It would be very cool if you‚Äôre opinionated / excited about well-tested frontend code (Jest, Enzyme, React Testing Library), automation, or other aspects of frontend ops‚Äîthe force multipliers that make other engineers love working together.

A few of our Product Engineering values

  • Code with Empathy‚Äîwrite your code thinking about the person who might use it next, that person might be you ;)
  • Don‚Äôt follow the GPS into the lake‚Äîbe intuitive and critical, be human when you work, especially when taking an empirical point of view.
  • Don‚Äôt take all of the blame‚Äîwhen software breaks, we‚Äôre all on the hook. Another way to say this is there are no gatekeepers. We share knowledge, responsibility, and an excitement for fixing things when they inevitably go sideways.

Life at OpenFin

At OpenFin, our mission is to stay on the cutting edge of web technologies and to enable our customers to do the same. While we are currently remote, we pride ourselves on our friendly, diverse, understanding office culture. Our goal is to create a space where employees can learn and innovate, and overall, have a good time doing it. Our employees have a diverse set of interests and experiences, and we encourage you to explore those interests and share with us! We have regular happy hours and social events. Our office and our employees are conducive to a productive learning experience -- all the while creating innovative and compelling solutions for our clients.

About Applied
Autonomy is one of the leading technological advances of this century that will come to impact our lives. The work you‚Äôll do at Applied will meaningfully accelerate the efforts of the top autonomy teams in the world. At Applied, you will have a unique perspective on the development of cutting edge technology while working with major players across the industry and the globe.

As the foremost enabler of autonomous vehicle development, Applied Intuition equips engineering and product teams with software that makes it faster, safer, and easier to bring autonomy to market. Applied‚Äôs suite of products, focused on simulation and analytics, delivers sophisticated infrastructure built for scale. Companies of all sizes use Applied to comprehensively test and rapidly accelerate their autonomous vehicle development. Headquartered in Silicon Valley with offices in Detroit, Tokyo, Munich, and Seoul, Applied is composed of software and automotive experts from the top companies in the world (such as Google, Amazon, Apple, Waymo, Tesla, Delphi, GM, and Bosch).

About the Role
(We are hiring for all levels of experience.)

We are looking for bright engineers interested in designing elegant solutions to difficult problems in the autonomy space. Our software engineers work across our suite of products, tackling a variety of full-stack, infrastructure, robotics, and graphics challenges. At Applied, we encourage all engineers to take ownership over technical and product decisions, closely interact with users to collect feedback, and contribute to a thoughtful, dynamic team culture.

At Applied, you will:

  • Work across our entire stack to develop new products, features, and tools for our customers' autonomy development workflows
  • Have an unparalleled opportunity to work with domain experts across a variety of fields: infrastructure, robotics, and graphics engineers, as well as startup veterans
  • Carve out your own area of expertise and influence product decisions
  • Collaborate with other members in the autonomy ecosystem and learn about different approaches to solving core issues in autonomy

We are looking for someone who:

  • Is a self-starter and can quickly become comfortable with new technical tools
  • Designs efficient and effective solutions to a wide range of engineering challenges
  • Takes initiative in a fast-paced environment

Nice to have:

  • Working knowledge of frontend, API layer, database ORM, containerization, or cluster orchestration frameworks (such as React, GraphQL, SQLAlchemy, Docker, or Kubernetes)
  • Experience working with simulation tools, modeling physical problems, or using robotics middlewares (such as ROS)

Work

  • Should be eager to learn new technologies
  • Should have experience with C# programming
  • Understanding of OOPS concepts and knowledge of C#, .Net framework.
  • Vector Mathematics
  • Good knowledge of Unity, including experience with scripting, textures, animation, GUI and user session management
  • Must have experience in AR Core, Vuforia.
  • Good to have experience with Oculus SDK, ARKit.
  • Good to have knowledge of Photon Unity Networking.
  • Translate design specification into functional immersive experience.
  • Communicate with other team members to establish effective pipeline and integrate media assets
  • Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable code
  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization
  • Experience of WebRTC is a plus.

Perks

  • Work in challenging demos and client projects
  • Work from any where in the world
  • Conversion of Internship to PPO
  • Certificate on successful completion of internship
