Fyusion is a machine learning & computer vision company that enables anyone to capture and display interactive 3D 360 images using their smartphone. Our unique 3D format allows for significant additional functionality that 2D images can‚Äôt offer, including: background image effects & automatic damage detection for cars, and an understanding of the human skeleton for tagging products & features in fashion E-commerce. Our investors and customers include large international conglomerates and industry leaders, which puts us in a unique and advantageous position. We have ambitious goals and are looking for new energetic team members to help us reach them together.

The Computer Vision team at Fyusion develops and applies state of the art algorithms in visualization, 3D reconstruction, SLAM, bundle adjustment, state estimation, and sensor fusion. We combine this with the efforts from our Machine Learning team to deliver an intelligent product which is loved by our customers.
We are looking for candidates who are excited about solving complex problems at the intersection of classical 3D geometry and Deep Learning. You will have the resources and opportunities to publish your work at major conferences.

Here are our requirements:

  • Experience with 3D geometry, SLAM, Structure from Motion, bundle adjustment, view synthesis
  • Proficient in C++, OpenCV

Bonus if you have experience with Computer Graphics:

  • NeRF (Representing Scenes as Neural Radiance Fields for View Synthesis)
  • Rendering photorealistic data
  • image based rendering
  • computational geometry

Here's what we can offer you:

Paid company holidays, commuter benefits, company catered lunches, a fully stocked snack pantry, team and company off-sites, but the most exciting: the chance to work on an incredible pioneering technology team that impacts user-facing services.

If you read this and think this is what you want to do, apply! If you read this, and think that you might need some help hitting all of the points, please apply! We have an entire team that is happy to mentor and share their knowledge with you.

Blink Health Pharmacy is a new tech-powered pharmacy revolutionizing the way people access prescription medicine. Our pharmacy is affiliated with Blink Health, which leverages its proprietary technology to provide users with access to low negotiated prices on over 15,000 medications.

Our core mission is to delight our customers and turn them into fans. We understand that in order to do this, we must work closely with pharmacies to ensure prescriptions can be processed quickly and effectively so our customers receive the best experience. You are Blink's champion with the pharmacy. You will field calls to and from pharmacies and prescribers, obtaining prescriptions for Blink‚Äôs patients.

We are looking to you to create positive relationships with our pharmacies by assisting them in filling our customers‚Äô medications. This is your opportunity to join a health-tech enterprise. Apply your expertise outside of the retail space in a new and exciting way that offers innovative new services to patients nationwide.

Responsibilities:

  • Field calls from patients, providers and pharmacies across the country
  • Receive, enter, process and fill prescriptions as per Blink protocols.
  • Obtain a fundamental understanding of the Blink Health product for quick pharmacy assistance
  • Resolve open orders through communication with pharmacists and the Blink Health Customer Experience team
  • Perform all tasks in a safe and compliant manner that is consistent with corporate policies as well as State and Federal laws
  • Work collaboratively with the management team and pharmacists
  • Under the direct supervision of a pharmacist, perform tasks such as external pharmacy transfers, internal pharmacy transfers, and internal verbal orders from providers.
  • Other responsibilities as assigned by Pharmacist in Charge

Requirements:

  • Must at least be in Professional Year 2 in an accredited Pharmacy School
  • PA Intern License
  • Strong phone presence in a support/service capacity
  • Strong attention to detail with a high degree of accuracy

  • Strong technical aptitude and ability to learn complex new software

  • On-site in Pittsburgh

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity of all kinds. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

About Us

Greendeck is one of Europe‚Äôs leading retail-tech companies. We use artificial intelligence to help retailers and retail brands make better pricing, marketing and merchandising decisions.

We are a small team - based across London and Indore - with a big vision and are growing rapidly. We‚Äôre a Techstars company, and are backed by some of London‚Äôs biggest VCs. We have been awarded UK‚Äôs ‚ÄòStartup of the Year‚Äô and also featured by Forbes as a startup 'set to blaze a trail'.

We are looking for

A Data Analyst who will be working on gathering data and improving the processes and systems. You'll also conduct research and analysis to assist the teams deliver the highest quality products to our customers.

You'll work closely alongside our client facing teams, machine learning engineers, frontend and wider technical team to build new capabilities, focused on speed and reliability.

Your work includes

  • Writing scrapers for websites to gather data
  • Creating big data pipelines to standardize the data
  • Own and manage the big data pipeline that collects more than 100M items daily
  • Participate in ad-hoc data extraction requests by customers

Skills/ Requirements

  • Good knowledge and experience of writing scripts in Python.
  • Good knowledge of Beautiful Soup (Python library) and basic html elements and techniques used while scraping.
  • Basic experience and knowledge of using REST APIs
  • Basic knowledge of the Scrapy framework
  • Basic knowledge of any database
  • A good grasp on the basic concepts of any one git tool like Gitlab/Github

What you can expect

  • Attractive pay, bonus scheme and flexible vacation policy.
  • A truly flexible, trust-based, performance driven work culture.
  • A young and passionate team building elegant products with intricate technology for the future of retail and e-commerce. Our average age is 25!
  • The chance to make a huge difference to the success of a world-class SaaS product and the opportunity to make an impact.
  • Lunch is on us, every day!

Its important to us

  • That you relocate to Indore as and when we open our offices (when its safe to do so!)

Please submit your resume before May 19th 2021

About Compa

Compa is a new way to create offers with software. Our data science engine scales compensation analysis so that every decision is data-driven. Data-driven decisions help us make better human decisions. Our tools are designed to make compensation easy to understand and communicate so offer decisions are consistently fast and accountable.

Creating offers should be simple, unbiased, and designed to win. Compa makes this possible, and opens up incredible new ways to understand and manage compensation outcomes at scale.

About the role

Compa is looking for interns to join our team. As an intern, you will join Compa for 10 weeks and work on our core product and systems.
We‚Äôre looking for interns that want to code, grow, and have an impact on the world:

Code

  • Work with Compa‚Äôs engineers and CTO to build a core product feature end-to-end.
  • Work on Compa‚Äôs React frontend and Django backend.
  • Coding is a team sport at Compa - we work together to build the best features and scalable systems.

Grow

  • As intern, you will be giving meaningful work and contribute directly to Compa‚Äôs core product and systems under the guidance of experienced engineers.
  • Our founding engineering team is passionate about helping engineers grow to their full potential - and has a track record of doing so at Facebook and Oculus.
  • Compa is a safe place to learn and to grow - we have a no blame culture. Human error is a consequence of complex systems, not bad people. When mistakes happen, we work together to make our systems more resilient, not hunt for blame.

Impact

  • We‚Äôre applying technology to build scalable solutions to one of society‚Äôs toughest challenges - making compensation more transparent, fair, and equitable.
  • Pay is deeply personal and affects everyone who works for a living. At Compa you‚Äôll be part of a small team on the frontier of making compensation better for everyone.
  • We‚Äôre a VC-backed early-stage startup, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to influence matters of company culture, strategy, go-to-market, and fundraising.

About you

  • You want to make compensation more transparent, fair, and equitable.
  • You want to learn in highly ambiguous and constantly changing situations.
  • You have a bias for action - transform ambiguity and uncertainty into concrete next steps.
  • You are able to overcome obstacles to ship - done is better than perfect!
  • You are a collaborative problem solver.
  • You are looking to realize your potential by engaging with challenging problems, both technical and societal.

Bonus Points

  • Experience with React and/or Django

Since 2008, Simulmedia‚Äôs mission has been to make TV and video work better for advertisers. Our demand-side TV buying platform generates more wins for advertisers across linear TV, streaming, and gaming. We leverage TV‚Äôs unparalleled reach and the power of data to help brands, networks, and agencies find audiences most likely to take notice, tune in, and transact. Our goal is to empower both performance and brand marketers to take direct control of their TV buying and drive greater business impact with every ad dollar spent. We‚Äôre already helping hundreds of brands like Experian, 1-800-Flowers, Dollar Shave Club, HBO Max, Michaels, and MassMutual grow their reach, awareness, and conversions.

As an Analytics Intern at Simulmedia, you will face complex technical challenges that relate to the television advertising industry. You will be mining complex datasets to provide useful insights to various stakeholders such as account managers and the product team. You will be engaged in supporting ad-hoc client requests related to the launch, management, and optimization of advertising campaigns. Some of these requests will eventually turn into larger, productionable projects in which you will work with the rest of the Science and Engineering teams.

The Analytics Intern will, at times, be engaged in the information discovery phase to gather requirements and client requests. The ideal candidate is eager to work with Data Scientists and Account Managers and has data mining and data analysis capabilities focusing on SQL and Python, business acumen and strong analytical skills. Additionally, you will write complex queries delivering insights and reports to clients and deliver ad hoc data analyses that provide strategic insights to clients.

Skills & Experience

  • Proficiency in both Python and SQL and can transform data into an appropriate shape to use for modeling
  • Experience with quantitative challenges involving real world data and are comfortable building efficient code to share while learning new technologies
  • A keen analytical mind with the ability to understand business problems communicated by an Account Manager and distill complex information into understandable insights with actionable recommendations

The Simulmedia Experience
We take tremendous pride in maintaining a high bar for employees and fostering a strong team environment. While we work hard every day, we also believe in relaxing together with lots of team activities. We have an unlimited vacation policy, tuition reimbursement, and no employee financial contribution for medical, dental, and vision benefits. We offer competitive salaries, stock options, and an annual bonus based on performance. And last but not least, we provide a free Citibike membership to all employees!

To be the first place advertisers go to find and scale their high-value audiences and elevate the accountability and performance of their TV and video advertising.

description:
About the Company:

Hobo Video is a vernacular fun video based localized community driven marketplace for billions of generation Z and millennials where everybody can earn.

We are on a mission to make online shopping real via video streaming in a language the audience is most comfortable with and to provide revenue streams to influencers and small sellers by making an ecosystem of video commerce.

We are looking for a talented intern as Digital Presence and SEO Executive to work along with the founders and leadership team!

We are looking for a member to add to our team of entrepreneurs. This could be a HUGE opportunity for someone passionate about learning and working in a high potential growth industry, flexible hours and schedule, and working alongside founders and leadership team to learn the in‚Äôs and out‚Äôs of getting a hyper-growth business built, launched, and growing! We are extremely passionate about what we‚Äôre doing and want someone that is going to share in that belief and attitude.

We value our interns as team members. As a Digital Presence and SEO Executive, you get to be a part of the revolution! We are building delightful experiences for some of the best platform teams out there, and an internship at Hobo only means you envision, build, and ship for them. At Hobo, you can take on big responsibilities to solve some of today's greatest problems.
If you want to learn how organizations around the world work with data and solve problems, apply now!

Responsibilities of Digital Presence and SEO Executive

  • Work with the Marketing and SEO leaders to research people and websites
  • Import and organize people and websites within sheet to build backlinks
  • Use web-based tools to submit multiple business listings
  • Perform and track outreach through social, email and telephone
  • Report to SEO Manager with successes, progress and opportunities
  • Work on offpage SEO
  • Listing about Hobo.Video on business listing website
  • Adopt new forums to write about Hobo.Video
  • Produce content and post on forums and business websites to build strong online presence
  • Have online presence where your audience is to resolve their issue or to engage with them
  • Measure and report performance of all digital campaigns, and assess against goals (ROI and KPIs)
  • Identify trends and insights, and optimize time and efforts based on the insights
  • Brainstorm new and creative growth strategies
  • Plan, execute, and measure experiments and conversion tests
  • Utilize strong analytical ability to evaluate end-to-end customer experience across multiple channels and customer touch points
  • Instrument conversion points and optimize user funnels
  • Collaborate with agencies and other vendor partners
  • Evaluate emerging platforms and technologies. Provide thoughts to leadership team and perspective for adoption where appropriate

Preferred Qualifications

  1. BS/MS/MBA students in marketing or a related field
  2. Previous working experience in digital marketing
  3. Demonstrable experience leading and managing SEO/SEM, marketing database
  4. Experience with A/B and multivariate experiments
  5. Solid knowledge of website analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Firebase)
  6. Strong analytical skills and data-driven thinking
  7. Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in online marketing and measurement
  8. Knowledge about building strong online presence and passion of SEO

COMPANY BENEFITS:

  1. Generous holiday allowance: Hobo.Video operates enhanced holiday allowance increasing for every complete year of employment. We also offer a paid Christmas shutdown break between 25 Dec - 29 Dec along with paid shutdown break of 4 days on Diwali!
  2. All this is in addition to bank holidays and company holiday days.
  3. We keep transparency and equality as the first thing for employees and learning as the utmost priority.
  4. Team events: We have many social activities, team events, All hands meeting every 15 days and annual company summits
  5. We believe in employee-first company and working each day to become world class culture.
  6. We believe in flexible working hours as we have employees from multiple countries who choose their working time as per their timezone.
  7. Amazing culture: We have an open culture where we believe every person to own the part of this Hobo Ship and come upfront with their ideas to implement.
  8. Here you will get to work with a top notch modern leadership team and talk to them directly without any hierarchy in between!

Go Off is an emerging social platform that hosts small live-chat discussions which are moderated to help break echo chambers and enhance engagement. Our mission is to design a user centered social platform through shared media interests with a focus on transparency and trust. We've noticed that genuine and honest engagement with consumers is getting harder and harder on current social media platforms, so we created a channel through which brands and companies can host conversations which offers transparent marketing and replaces focus groups. On top of this we provide analytics of the conversations they host on our platform and share it with the companies after.

With over 150 active users within our first month of our Beta Launch, we are a growing company and have recently met with interested corporations and companies such as IBM and Edelman. We have also secured a B2B pilot for this upcoming spring to test our monetization strategy. We are in need of a skilled Database Administrator to help us continue building our product.

Job Description
VertiGrow builds tools for urban vertical farmers who are reshaping our food supply chains by growing food closer to end markets. Our systems empower urban farmers by managing farm logistics and growing processes, allowing farmers to more easily manage and expand their operations. Urban vertical farming reduces the environmental impact of farming through reduced land and resource consumption and shortening of supply chains. Urban farming also increases the number of local jobs and entrepreneurs, and keeps more money in local economies.

Our current product offering, FarmWare, is a full scale farm management software designed for these types of farms. The Backend Software Developer will frontrun development of FarmWare's backend codebase with support from our development team.

Duties and responsibilities

  • Add new functionality to our backend
  • Optimize the current backend codebase to reduce process times and server load
  • Optimize existing features based on beta tester feedback
  • Work with our engineer to connect our farm automation systems to our new web based application, FarmWare.

Knowledge and skills

  • Experience with Python and SQL languages
  • Experience with server/client architecture
  • Experience integrating hardware with software
  • Ability to work autonomously
  • Familiarity with distributed version control systems such as Git

Education required
Undergraduate Degree in Engineering, Computer Sciences or similar discipline

6 month internship with potential for full time hire afterwards

Basketball is a passion of mine -- since I was young, I've been looking for a way to make a career of basketball (the NBA didn't pan out). At MacroXStudio, our mission is to become the best alternative data (‚ÄúBig Data‚Äù) and AI based macro asset manager by measuring the world macroeconomy faster and better using thousands of new data sources like twitter, search, credit card, satellite data etc., rather than the incomplete, months delayed, slow, and frequently revised Government data.

We‚Äôre a venture-backed, early-stage enterprise SaaS startup, and our entire team comes out of Stanford, MIT, IITs, and various enterprise SaaS companies.

Role
We are building the world‚Äôs pioneering emotional intelligence platform for video calls, and the role involves learning and working with semi-structured, and multi-modal data of video, audio and text.
Our platform powered by Zoom‚Äôs special API access has very novel challenges around real time scaling and building advanced engineering pipelines.

Requirements

Benefits

About the Role

As an intern at Sigma you will learn:

  • How to build production software.
  • How large Single Page Applications are built and extended.
  • How backend scales to handle multiple customers and billions of data points while keeping the information secure.
  • How to own a project beginning to end.

We are an inclusive team of software engineers who complement each other's skills to inspire and design solutions that power the Sigma product experience. As an intern on this team, you will have the opportunity to experiment, prototype and implement user visible features that help our customers analyze and gather insights from their data. During the internship period, you will be paired with a mentor and collaborate with other team members, develop designs and implement a chosen solution, deploy and gather insights from customer metrics.

During your internship, you will

position: BardoVR Internship: BardoVR - An Interactive & Immersive Platform For Change
description:
BardoVR‚Äôs ‚ÄúAfterDeath‚Äù is an interactive, game-based VR simulation of the Tibetan Book of the Dead, which describes the journey consciousness takes from the moment of death until its rebirth in another form. Using mindful, meditation-based techniques- calm focus, equanimity, compassion - ‚Äúplayers‚Äù access increasingly higher realms within the game-simulation, as they simultaneously deepen their meditation practice.

Who are we looking for? We are looking for smart, motivated, and creative people who are passionate about TRANSFORMATIVE TECHNOLOGY to join the BARDOVR. We are looking for people who want to change the world! Do you have an interest in Virtual Reality (VR), Fractal Generation, game design/development, health and wellbeing, data analytics/big data, games for change, positive psychology, neuroscience, Buddhism, psychedelics, or growth hacking? We are looking for you.

Projects Include:
*Virtual Reality (Vr) Design And Development
*Game Design And Development
*Procedural Generation In Game Design/Procedural Generation In Vr
*Fractal Technology
*Business Development/Partnership Outreach.
*Growth Hacking & Community Development
*Games For Change
*Serious Games

What will you get working with BardoVR?

  • Opportunity - we offer real world experience working in a startup that is improving people‚Äôs lives. You will work directly with our management team, technology partners, and wellbeing community .
  • Access - to a visionary group of transformative technology thinkers, innovators, entrepreneurs, and artists who want to change the world.
  • Mentoring - works with you to expand your skillset, add to your domain expertise, and grow your network.
  • Training - project management, software tools, and access to Wellbeing products and services.

A few things to know about this position:

  • Position is unpaid. We support CPT and academic credit internships (if your school offers these programs).
  • Equity compensation based on performance and long term role at BardoVRavailable.
  • Requires a minimum ~10 hrs per week (depending on role and responsibilities).
  • Requires a minimum commitment of 1-2 months (longer commitments - a plus!).

We believe that BardoVR can become a radical platform for change: an awe-inspiring gamified tool, grounded in ancient wisdom, that not only benefits meditators but specifically targets gamers and VR experience-seekers who otherwise might never come in contact with these profound teachings. It is a BIG vision! Are you interested?

position: Internship: Web Development /Community Development - For BardoVR: The Gamification Of Mindfulness/Meditation
description:
Interested in Virtual Reality (VR), VR Gaming and Games For Change? We are looking for you! BardoVR‚Äôs ‚ÄúAfterDeath‚Äù is an interactive, game-based VR simulation of the Tibetan Book of the Dead, which describes the journey consciousness takes from the moment of death until its rebirth in another form. Using mindful, meditation-based techniques (calm focus, equanimity, compassion) - ‚Äúplayers‚Äù access increasingly higher realms within the game-simulation, as they simultaneously deepen their mindfulness/meditation practice.

Job Description
*We are an early stage startup with lots of VR hats to wear. *

  • Web development intern. Build landing pages to A/B messaging and product market fit.**
  • Front End Development - work with web team to optimize, update, and development web offerings. Including design, development,and analytics.
  • Berkeley/LA-based. Virtual internship - Ok.**

We are looking for candidates that are interested in web development, A/B testing, Transformative Technology, Virtual Reality (VR), Fractal Generation, game design/development, health and wellbeing, data analytics/big data, games for change, positive psychology, neuroscience, Buddhism, psychedelics, or growth hacking.

*This is currently how it works: *

  • Enter Bardo (immersive/psychedelic world) where the practice of mindfulness is employed as a game mechanic.
  • If the gamer has 5X three-minute meditation/mindfulness streaks, they progress thru the Bardo Gates.
  • Ultimately, the meditation/mindfulness needed to progress gets harder in the form of longer streaks and more distractions (just like real meditation!).
  • At the last gate of the Bardo, the player chooses (thru eye gaze) their character rebirth in one of the 6 realms (God, DemiGod, Human, Animal, Ghost, Hell).
  • Each of the 6 realms has psychological qualities (see attachment) that become the foundation for prosocial (tend and befriend) game mechanics.
  • Like life... you die at some point and begin again - "entering the Bardo".
  • Every time you play the game, you have the chance for a new experience.
  • We are exploring ways to measure the mental state/wellbeing of players, pre and post gaming experience to show that exposure to gamified meditation/mindfulness practice and prosocial game mechanics makes us happier and healthier (this is our thesis).

*This Summer we are launching our Build In The Open (inspired by John Saddington at Yen.fm). I am super excited. *

  • We have a team engaing with our communities, having conversations about BardoVR.
  • We are asking for community for input on the development of BardoVR levels, characters, game mechanics, etc
  • We have a team that takes the community inputs and turns them into micro game experiences.
  • At the end of the Summer, we will have received great feedback from our community, built relationships with future customers, and learned a lot!

What will you get working with BardoVR?

  • Opportunity: Experience working with emerging VR and VR gaming technologies.
  • Visionary Product: Be part of the team that is building an awe-inspiring gamified tool that changes lives.
  • Access: BardoVR is working with a visionary group of transformative technology thinkers, innovators, entrepreneurs, and artists who want to change the world.
  • Training: Opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects (VR, data analytics, product development, biz development, and social media/marketing).
  • References/Recommendation

*A few things to know about this position: *

  • Position is unpaid (we are actively raising money). We support CPT and academic credit internships (if your school offers these programs).
  • Requires a minimum ~15 hrs per week (depending on role and responsibilities).
  • Requires a minimum commitment of 1-2 months (longer commitments - a plus!).

Please include your resume, and** tell us what you like about we are doing at BardoVR**! If you do not hear from us, please be patient ‚Äì we are growing rapidly. More info @ https://www.bardovr.com/. Contact bst@bardovr.com for more info and/or with any questions!

Thanks.

Ben Simon-Thomas
Co-Founder/Executive Producer BardoVR

BardoVR team:

  • Tom Seidman - Writer/Director. Dartmouth College, American Film Institute (Directing Fellow). DGA Assistant Director for Robert Redford, Clint Eastwood, Peter Weir. Independent filmmaker. Meditiator/student of Buddhism for over 25 yrs.
  • Ben Simon-Thomas - Executive Producer. Buddhist-leaning entrepreneur and ecosystem developer. Founded startups in the Wellbeing/Digital Therapeutics, 3D space (SoundFit: 3D Scanning & ODMS: parts-on-demand), social commerce (GroupGain), worked in health-care startups and life style modification businesses (PMRI). MA in Buddhist psychology, degrees in Religious Philosophy and Language.
  • Grant Anderson - VR Producer. Former Executive Director at Sony‚Äôs 3D Center working with filmmakers including Baz Luhrmann, Ridley Scott, Ang Lee. CGI work on Academy Award-winning teams for Titanic, Spider-Man. Former Studio Head, Jaunt VR. Recently produced location-based VR experience of the Marvel Universe for Disney.

description:
Position Summary:

We are looking for an enthusiastic software QA engineer to help us update the product documentation and improve the performance and usability of our mobile app and web-based subscription for brands and retailers. This position is both a technical product management position and a QA engineer position.

We are looking for a Quality Assurance (QA) engineer to develop and execute exploratory and automated tests to ensure product quality.

QA engineer responsibilities include designing and implementing tests, debugging and defining corrective actions. You will also review system requirements and track quality assurance metrics (e.g. defect campaign workflows and collaboration opportunities with matchmaking brands to creatives.)

The QA technician role plays an important part in our company‚Äôs product development process. Our ideal candidate will be responsible for conducting tests before product launches to ensure software runs smoothly and meets customer needs, while being cost-effective. If you hold an engineering background and enjoy providing end-to-end solutions to software quality problems, we'd like to meet you.

Ultimately, you should monitor all stages of software development to identify and resolve system malfunctions to meet quality standards.

Responsibilities

  • Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback
  • Create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases
  • Estimate, prioritize, plan and coordinate testing activities
  • Design, develop and execute automation scripts using open source tools
  • Identify, record, document thoroughly and track bugs
  • Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved
  • Develop and apply testing processes for new and existing products to meet client needs
  • Liaise with internal teams (e.g. developers and product managers) to identify system requirements
  • Monitor debugging process results
  • Investigate the causes of non-conforming software and train users to implement solutions
  • Track quality assurance metrics, like defect densities and open defect counts
  • Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies

Requirements

  • Proven work experience in software development
  • Proven work experience in software quality assurance
  • Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools and processes
  • Experience in writing clear, concise and comprehensive test plans and test cases
  • Hands-on experience with both white box and black box testing
  • Hands-on experience with automated testing tools
  • Solid knowledge of SQL and scripting
  • Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process
  • Experience with performance and/or security testing is a plus
  • Pursuing BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject

Education/Experience:

  • Current enrollment in an accredited university or development program
  • Essential Competencies And Behaviors
  • Highly self-motivated contributor who works well as an individual and within a team environment
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Detail-oriented and highly organized with the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment.

DTonomy‚Äôs Assisted Incident Response platform (AIR) orchestrates hundreds of internal and external data sources and tools into a single platform, and leverages automation and artificial intelligence to enable analysts to triage all alarms and threats, not just the highest rated or most critical, without additional investment in resource.

About us

Trexo Robotics (YC W19, Techstars) is enabling mobility by building powered wearable robots (https://youtu.be/3LW4LJIpa2o). Our first product is a robot for children with movement disorders such as Cerebral Palsy and it allows kids to walk, in many cases for the first time in their lives. The device is currently being used by families and the best hospitals across North America.

Our work doesn‚Äôt stop here, we are constantly working towards building mobility solutions for all. At Trexo Robotics you will find a flat organization where you can work with highly optimistic, low ego and exceptionally talented individuals who look forward to solving hard problems.

About the Job

We currently have Trexos all over North America and an even growing backlog of Trexos we need to ship! We need to ensure that we test each device on all fronts and find issues before our users do so we can fix them and make a product which always works, no exceptions. We are looking for a Robot Destroyer intern to take responsibility of figuring out all the problems conceivable in the Trexo and constantly improving the overall quality and reliability.

About You

You want to work in a small team solving a big problem while helping an underserved community. You love when products just work and cant believe how some bugs make it out in the wild. You are detail oriented and love asking why many times till you understand something from first principles.

What you'll do

Compensation and Benefits

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Epoch Games is a volunteer based, all-online, global game development team (we have no centrally-located headquarters). Most of the original founding members were modders developing the total conversion Middle Earth Roleplaying Project (MERP) mod for the Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim:
http://www.moddb.com/mods/merp-middle-earth-roleplaying-project

Currently Epoch Games is developing Lays of Althas: Sundered Order (LoA:SO). LoA:SO is an in-development indie open-world RPG set in an original fantasy world. The game is being developed using Epic Games' Unreal Engine 4 (UE4):
https://www.unrealengine.com/

For more information about the game, please check out our IndieDb page:
http://www.indiedb.com/games/the-lays-of-althas-sundered-order

NOTE: Although Epoch Games does have a formal office at the listed address, we have a fully-online team at this time. Communication is mostly done via Slack (an instant messaging application) and Trello (an online project collaboration tool).

JOB DESCRIPTION

In this volunteer position you will be working closely with other members of the Coding department to develop C++ code and/or Blueprint scripts for the Lays of Althas: Sundered Order (LoA:SO). Keep in mind that we are using Epic Game‚Äôs Unreal Engine 4 (UE4) to develop the game, and knowledge of how C++ code and/or Blueprint scripts interacts with UE4 is required. Knowledge of both C++ programming and Blueprint scripting in UE4 is recommended, but knowledge of one of the two is required.

Communication is key to a smooth and efficient pipeline, you must be able to communicate clearly and effectively with other team-members and not be afraid to ask should any problems arise. We are an English-speaking team, so English fluency is a must.

If you are comfortable with teaching, you may be called upon to aid the more junior members of the team in any relevant area.

Other duties include: attending Slack meetings (Slack is an instant messaging we communicate with); completing monthly reports; and following team policies.

QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum Skill Requirements:

  • Either C++ programming experience in Unreal Engine 4 and/or strong Blueprint scripting experience in Unreal Engine 4
  • Providing clear and legible code
  • Online communication, team-collaboration skills, and English fluency
  • A passion for coding and a dedication to creating AAA quality games

Recommended Skill Requirements:

  • Knowledge of both C++ programming and Blueprint scripting in Unreal Engine
  • Git Version Control experience
  • AI programming/scripting
  • At least 1 Unreal Engine project (using C++ code and/or Blueprint scripts) prepared to show prior to the interview. If none, we can provide an assignment before or at the interview.

Minimum Hardware Requirements:

  • The ability to run Unreal Engine 4 (https://www.unrealengine.com/register).
  • The ability to run a C++ IDE. Visual Studio Community Edition (https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/downloads/) with the Unreal Engine package is recommended.
  • The disk space and Internet Speeds to download (pull) several GB of game files, as well as upload (push) files to an online version control repository.

Why Adaface?

Adaface is B2B SaaS company founded by IIT alums- Siddhartha Gunti and Deepti Chopra. Combined we've done research in NLP/AI at institutions like Caltech, led product teams at startups taking them from seed to series A and developed quant models at enterprises like Goldman Sachs.

With Adaface, we are changing the way tech recruitment works for generation-z with our chatbot Ada. Ada is the world's first skills assessment chatbot- top candidates prefer Adaface because Ada engages with a friendly chat involving relevant challenges as opposed to asking trick questions on a test. With Ada we enable companies to identify the best engineers faster and build strong teams.

We are incubated at Enterpreneur First, Singapore based accelerator funded by Reid Hoffman of LinkedIn. We are at a crucial point in the company with high m-o-m growth and ambitious goals. We are excited to grow our core team with talented and entrepreneurial members.

What will you do?

  • Develop high-quality, creative questions involving various Computer Science and/or Aptitude concepts. The questions will be used by companies like Amazon, Singapore Govt, PayPal etc in hiring next generation of engineers using Ada
  • Learn new skills and online tools. We're always expanding our content and adding new topics. If any skill interests you, we help you pick up the new skill while contributing to Adaface content

What impact will you have?

Ada is on track to have a chat with every developer in the world and is being used by top companies to build best teams. Every qualified content piece written by you will help Ada expand the library and help achieve the mission faster. You would be a reason candidates will leave a pre-employment chat with a smile :)

What is the hiring process?

Chat with Ada followed by interview. Short and simple.

Eligibility Criteria

  • High aptitude is a MUST-have and hunger for learning is a MUST-have.
  • 0+ years of experience.
  • Computer Science degree or equivalent is preferred but NOT a must.
  • Knowledge of algorithms and competitive programming experience is preferred but NOT a mandatory requirement.

position: Front-end Developer/Intern Web Developer (WordPress) - Immediate start
description:
*CFTE: Front-end Developer/Intern Web Developer *

About the role:

*Immediate start date required

We are looking for a Front-end Developer intern for our London office, joining the Infrastructure team in charge of building a new learning platform. This is an opportunity to upskill yourself in all things Fintech as you will be exposed to working closely with the Product and Marketing team to drive the vision and message of CFTE‚Äôs future platform. The ideal candidate is a highly motivated recently graduate/current student interested in pursuing a career in web development. This is a paid internship in the UK, however we are flexible with remote-working and will hire from other countries for the right fit.

The role is a 3 month internship, with the possibility of converting it into a full-time role. The compensation is between ¬£800-¬£1000 pm, with many additional bonuses like our WFH allowance and Health & Wellness programme. In addition, we have monthly team lunches and free drinks at the office!

About your responsibilities:

  • Help building CFTE Think platform front end in coordination with the Product and Infrastructure Team following the high fidelity mockups on Figma.

  • Execute following WP best practices - in terms of performance and optimization.

  • Build dynamic dashboards using WP snippets fetching data from several sources.

  • Rebuild CSS pre built pages / Results from RestricContent / Algolia and Elementor.

Skills:

  • Experience in front-end web technologies such as HTML and CSS to build front-end UI components.
  • Strong knowledge and understanding of application architecture and how they interact with various systems.
  • Pursuing/completed a Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science/Information Technology.
  • Wordpress is a plus, but not a prerequisite.

We value your eagerness to learn, and therefore will also hire based on your motivation to learn the appropriate skills to empower your time at CFTE.

About you:

Ownership and accountability: you will be managing the external relationships of CFTE and our stakeholders in Singapore and the region. We expect someone who takes pride and ownership of their responsibilities.

Work ethics: flawless execution is something we expect, we can afford no mistakes in dealing with stakeholders.

Entrepreneurial Mindset: Any new role and projects come with challenges, you need to be a natural problem solver.

Process-driven with the ability to see the bigger picture and build communication processes with all our partners.

Excellent relationship and communication skills, both verbal and written.

An understanding and passion for Finance, Tech and Upskilling.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

  • Join a rapidly growing company building the future of education in finance. Size doesn‚Äôt matter, we are less than 20 but already reached thousands of learners, worked exceptional people from Harvard, Imperial College, HSBC, Citi, Ping An or Lloyds.

  • Working on some of the most important topics of today: Digital transformation, Technology disruption, Lifelong learning, Shift to an entrepreneurial age. All of which you will need in the future, whether in a corporate or start-ups.

  • Measure rapidly how your input impacts our company and if you can reach hundreds of learners.

  • Expose yourself to the Startup ecosystems in Europe and Asia and be part of the people building it.

  • Enjoy and work from our open office at the WeWork Canary Wharf, (where the coffee machine is an Ipad and the barista is an engineer).

About CFTE:

CFTE is looking for bright talents to join the team and help us push forward our educational mission by scaling our business. We are an education platform, connecting the best CEO, Entrepreneurs and Community member both online and off-line. We started in 2017 and since then grew to 20 team members and have learners from 100 countries.

  • You have what it takes to join us? Tell us who you are, what you can do for the company, and why we should hire you.

NB: The recruitment process includes a video interview, a case study and a meeting with the cofounders.

Job Description

Resolve is a social media app (in development) where users can put up monetary incentives called "bounties" to get things done online. On Resolve you will be able to turn your dollars directly into the actions of others. Resolve supports free market competitive forces for efficiency, but is run with the intent of improving the world and the people in it. The end result of what we created allows companies to power mobile in-app guides ontop of their native applications.

Postiion is unpaid until we are funded. Thus far bootstrapped but growing rapidly. Exceptions can be made if great performance or experience is demonstrated.

Demo Below:
[https://vimeo.com/388523357/b35e41d4d0]

We are looking to hire Software Development interns for the tech products we are building for venture capital and private equity markets. It is a great opportunity for people looking to make their careers as a software developer in product based tech companies.. We understand that the role does not offer much in terms of monetary compensation but is a great way to kickstart your career in core full stack software development and learn state of the art full stack web development skills.

The intern should be able to join us at least for 2 months and should be willing to commit 2-3 hours of dedicated development time on a daily basis. You‚Äôll have a chance to push your code to production within a week of joining the team. Interested candidates should include their CV (and past work samples).

Culture

Our team is completely remote with team members based in Japan, India and Canada. We are a company working in the space of Venture Capital and Private Equity focusing on startups from emerging markets and are (primarily) catered towards Japanese investors and companies (we don‚Äôt mind working with global players either)

Tech Stack:

Our tech stack is written in:

  • ReactJS for Frontend
  • NodeJS/Flask for backend (depending on which tech product team you join)
  • Cloud hosted MongoDB for database
  • Github for issue and project management
  • AWS (Amazon Web Services) for Deployment

Ideal Candidate

An ideal candidate should have some knowledge of concepts above and willingness to learn. We value commitment and dedication over past experience.

Software Development Methodology

We follow lean startup methodology and value iterative development over full-on product development cycles. We incorporate agile methodologies into development (we are not onto the stage for sprint planning YET). We follow continuous integration development style for deploying code.

About Investocracy:

Investocracy (https://www.investocracy.co/) is one of a kind startup and investment deal discovery platform focused on connecting startups from Africa and other emerging markets and is targeted towards Japanese investors and companies. We also operate a bi-lingual (English and Japanese) news and media platform invc.news catering to global startup information and updates. The company founder is an alumnus from IIT Kanpur, India.

We offer the following services:

  • Consulting services into raising funding, especially from Japan
  • Startup incubation service under our umbrella (currently work in progress)
  • Tech platform to connect founders and investors for pitch practice
  • Market research and custom made venture capital reports
  • Startup and Investor Networking Events
  • News and Media website (https://www.invc.news/) covering exclusive interviews with founders, funding related news, resources for entrepreneurs
  • Top startup and venture capital lists for a particular domain (example MedTech) in a particular geography (example: Singapore)

Our purpose is simple: Provide Information Democracy for global investments.

Samaritan seeks a team member to join us in helping people on the street access the resources needed to find a home. If that sounds like you, and you've got a gift for Android development, we'd love for you to consider sharing your gifts with the people we serve.

Outreach teams and case managers use our smart wallets‚Äîcalled beacons‚Äîas a resource for people experiencing homelessness. Individuals set their own housing and health goals and then can access the financial and social capital needed to meet those goals.

The Samaritan app enables providers to issue beacons, update goals & needs, and help beacon holders spend money. It also enables everyday individuals and organizations learn the stories of individuals and join their team of supporters to help them meet set goals. Over 10,000 "samaritans" invested >$100K and 1,000 letters of encouragement into a pilot cohort of 500 beacon holders, enabling dozens to reach life-changing outcomes. This is just the start, with additional pilots in LA, OKC, and NYC coming online soon (learn more).

You'll be joining an incredible task-force of 6 (one backend, one backend/Android, one iOS, and three non-technical). You'll collaborate to ship user-requested features and upgrades that grow the amount of financial & social capital that is put into the hands of people in need.

Samaritan hackers are compensated on a bounty system: every feature or upgrade has a bounty on it, which goes to you when you ship it. So the higher the impact you have for our users, the higher your compensation.

Strong preference given to candidates who can be onsite with us in Seattle (once this virus blows over). Will also consider a FT remote candidate in the right circumstances. Look forward to hearing from you!

SKILLS REQUIRED:

  • Native Android Java
  • Frontend Implementation & Animations
  • Git
  • Kotlin
  • Activities
  • Fragments
  • Services
  • Broadcast Receivers
  • REST API Integrations with Retrofit 2

PLUS:

  • RxJava and RxAndroid
  • Unit Testing with JUnit
  • UI Testing with Espresso Framework
  • CI

SOFT SKILLS:

  • Balance engineering excellence with velocity

  • Communicate effectively with teammates, onsite and remote

  • Translate information between technical and non-technical team members

  • Eagerness to own a feature from conception to deployment

  • Willingness to wear many hats (you might help design implementations for features that span multiple codebases and platforms‚Äîyou'll be responsible for doing whatever needs to be done to get features to users)

  • Quickly adapt and reprioritize to the needs of the team (no two days here are the same)

  • Ability to learn independently

position: W3LL: A Wellbeing Exploration & Discovery Platform (FullStack Developer)
description:
W3LL‚Äôs wellbeing exploration and discovery platform is an APP with SMS messaging, engaging/encouraging nudges (our secret sauce!), peer-to-peer support thru AI matched affinity groups (more secret sauce), and wellbeing resources that are easy to access and use. Most importantly, W3LL makes our community healthier, happier, and more hopeful.

*We are looking for candidates that want to change the world, and improve access to wellbeing/mental health resources. People with interests in positive psychology, neuroscience,and in transformative technology. Mental Health/Wellbeing tech is a rapidly growing veritcal. See https://pitchbook.com/news/articles/mental-health-startups-venture-capital-outpace-2019. *

W3LL is building a wellbeing exploration and discovery platform for seniors (then teens!). Seniors share how they feel on the W3LL platform. Our sentiment algorithms create well-being profiles and recommend scored media, product/services and educational content. And then we measure the impact.

By making W3LL accessible to everyone, we help seniors, care-providers, and family members know:

  • What song to play,
  • What class to attend
  • What app to download In order to streamline care and improve downstream outcomes.

In the last 11 months, we have run 2 senior discovery cohorts, meet with seniors and B2B partners and we have learned a lot. seniors want easy to find, easy to access, easy to use low tech + no tech solutions. What they have is a fragmented - hard to navigate well-being experience. This is a massive opportunity and big market. We are looking for our 2021 team!

We are an early stage startup with lots of hats to wear. W3LL is building an APP to support the W3LL platform. We are seeking a design/development intern to support the following:
*Full Stack Developer - Integrate existing algorithms including user profile functionality, recommendation engine, and content recommendation engine into web stack. Working alongside graphic designers for web design features. Developing front end website architecture. Designing user interactions on web pages. Creating servers and databases for functionality. Designing and developing APIs. Create databases that track and query events, calculate billing transactions and generate notification emails/nudges/reminders, and billing back end.

  • The applicant must be knowledgeable with the following languages: HTML, JavaScript, CSS, PHP, MySQL, & Linux. LA/Berkeley based - preferred. Virtual internship - Ok.

What will you get working with W3LL?

  • Opportunity: Experience working with emerging Transformative Technologies.
  • Visionary Product: Be part of the team that is building a marketplace that changes lives.
  • Access: W3LL is working with a visionary group of transformative technology thinkers, innovators, entrepreneurs, and artists who want to change the world.
  • Training: Opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects (AI/ML, data analytics, product development, biz development, and social media/marketing).
  • References/Recommendation

Please include your resume, and tell us what makes you unique! If you do not hear from us, please be patient ‚Äì we are growing rapidly. More info @ http://www.w3ll.xyz/. Contact bst@w3ll.xyz for more info and/or with any questions!

A few things to know about this position:

  • Position is unpaid. We support CPT and academic credit internships (if your school offers these programs).
  • Equity compensation based on performance and long term role at W3LL available.
  • Requires a minimum ~10-20 hrs per week (depending on role and responsibilities).
  • Requires a minimum commitment of 1-2 months (longer commitments - a plus!). Thanks.

Ben Simon-Thomas
Co-Founder - W3LL

W3ll team:
Brandon Howard: UI/UX Designer, Mindful Economist @ https://www.linkedin.com/in/bcehoward/
Ben Simon-Thomas: Ecosystem & Marketplace Developer @ https://www.linkedin.com/in/bensimonthomas/

description:

position: Data Scientist Intern in Travel Tech
description:
About the job

Hi there! Thanks for stopping by üëã

Have you ever heard of the Travelling Salesman Problem or the Orienteering Problem? üôã If the answer is yes, and you want to apply your skills to solving what is considered in the field as a true complex challenge, then this opportunity is for you so keep on reading!

We are looking for a talented and motivated Data Scientist Intern to join our team for a period of 3-6 months and help us build a product that customers love.

WHO ARE WE AND WHAT DO WE DO

Trippers is a B2C group travel planning platform helping travellers plan their next weekend getaway from A to Z. We are enabling remote and seamless end-to-end group travel planning through our mobile app: from finding suitable dates, to choosing a destination that matches everyone's tastes and budgets to booking and optimizing the group's itinerary for opening times, most efficient route and more. We are an international start-up based in Monaco, but working fully remotely, and are extremely passionate about shaping the future of travel. We are a team of 5, working to add efficiency to a painful outdated process.

As with most personalisation-focused companies, algorithmic plays a very important part in our product, from our city selection algorithms to our itinerary-maker, the options to grow and learn with Trippers as a data scientist are endless.

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR
We are looking for an Data Scientist Intern who doesn't shy away from a complex challenge, someone passionate about travel and finding the best solution to any one problem. You will join the team at the best possible time, in their final sprint towards getting an MVP out to market, within the next 3 months.

RESPONSIBILITIES
You will join the team as a data scientist, to design and implement complex algorithms in order to create or improve the different solutions developed by Trippers. Your main tasks will include :

Improving our city recommendation algorithm
Reviewing scientific literature on combinatorial optimization problems
Experimenting on various algorithmic solutions to solve the combinatorial optimization problem that the Trippers itinerary-maker functionality is
Designing and implementing the solution identified as the best one
Visualizing data so that non-technical people understand it
Interfacing with the development team for final implementation

MUST-HAVES
Background or degree in Data Science, Computer Science or similar.
Previous experience with optimization algorithms
Knowledge of Javascript
Strong problem-solving skills and willingness to roll up your sleeves to get the job done
Excellent communication skills.
Fluent in English and internationally-mined (we speak Italian, French, Portuguese and more)
Critical thinker and good problem-solver.
Demonstrated autonomy while also capable of working as part of a team
Interest in the future of travel tech is a plus

WHAT WE OFFER
A huge learning curve
One of the biggest responsibilities to take over
Insights into all parts of a start-up
Working directly with the CEO and CTO
Flexible working hours and remote working
Opportunity to be part of a rapidly-growing industry and to shape the future of travel

We are looking forward to getting to know you, so don't hesitate and reach out!

To Apply:
Apply online at bluestamp.campmanagement.com/apply.
AngelList applications will not be considered, you will be sent to our online application.

Instructor:
BlueStamp, LLC is looking for independent, motivated, kind, and technical people to join our summer staff in all locations. The position requires staff to work together to assist students in creating their projects. This will include teaching engineering techniques and concepts, tools and safety, technical documentation, and troubleshooting methods. Staff will guide students to ideas, approaches, and sources of solutions without "just doing it for them." The position will involve the following responsibilities:
Help students troubleshoot their projects.
Help students create their own student page.
Motivate, inspire, and share the love of building with students

Education and practical experience in one or more of the following three areas:
(1) Electronics Hardware, (2) Firmware/Software, (3) Mechanical Design and Drafting.

Significant experience with building, designing, and troubleshooting devices or prototypes of similar scope to student projects shown here: bluestampengineering.com/the-students.
Applicants should be able to showcase and discuss, in depth, any of their projects.

Skilled in troubleshooting problems and using the engineering tools of their discipline.

Experience teaching/leading students (e.g. instructor roles, youth camps, tutoring, mentoring, etc).
Ability to think and act quickly on a project to identify solutions that can meet goals on a structured, fast-paced schedule in a busy environment.

Desire to share the excitement of designing and engineering with high school students, while motivating students through the challenging and frustrating stages of prototype construction.
Excellent communication skills, unfettered honesty and integrity, and the ability to work with minimal supervision are all a must.

Program Logistics
The student-to-staff ratio is approximately ~3:1. Typically we assign 4 staff members to each section. The skill set for each section consists: of an electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, computer scientist, and Junior TA (previous exemplary BSE student).
Class meets Monday-Friday for 6 weeks (excluding 4th of July). Program start dates are typically mid-June to late July or early August and vary slightly by city.
Compensation: The position is paid on a stipend, depending on experience.
Instructors are eligible for an additional merit based bonus of 25% of total compensation.

All staff must pass a background check.

Posted positions are not open to third party recruiters/agencies and unsolicited resume submissions will be considered free referrals.*

About Coiled

Coiled scales Python to the cloud for data professionals. Based on Dask, the leading Python-native solution for distributed computing, Coiled has hosted more than 100M tasks for data professionals, scientists, and researchers around the globe including Capital One, Anthem Health, and the Air Force to solve challenges in business, research, and science. Coiled is a remote-first company with the best and brightest working from around the globe. Founded by the initial author of Dask, Coiled is on a mission to create a platform that gives Data Scientists the power of the cloud and machine learning, freeing them from today's limitations so they can solve important problems.

The Opportunity

Maybe the other engineering roles sound great, but you‚Äôre not sure that you have enough experience.

First, we encourage you to apply to those roles anyway. We‚Äôre happy to consider junior and senior candidates in each position. If you're still unsure, please apply here!

More About Us
Coiled is a remote-first company. We support you living and working from where you feel fulfilled, providing that you can collaborate effectively with your team.

Our Mission
We create software that gives Data Scientists unlimited power in the cloud for machine learning, freeing them from today's limitations - so they can solve important problems.

Coiled is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages people of all backgrounds, identities, and abilities to apply. We are committed to being a consciously inclusive place to work, valuing all ideas and perspectives.

Continuous learning. We're looking for software engineers who thrive on learning new technologies and don't believe in one-size-fits-all solutions. You should be able to adapt easily to meet the needs of our massive growth and rapidly evolving business environment.

Boldness. You think a working proof-of-concept is the best way to make a point. You strive on proving that speed and quality are not conflicting; that you can achieve both at the same time. You apply creativity to problem solving and can respond to feedback without bias.

Versatility. In addition to having an intimate knowledge of the API and service layers, you understand how all the pieces fit together (frontend, database, network layer, etc.) and how they impact the performance of your application.

Team player. You believe that you can achieve more on a team-that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts. You rely on others' candid feedback for continuous improvement.

Design and business acumen. You understand that to become a better engineer you need to have a diversity of thoughts and perspectives that can drive results. You take a human-centred and data-driven approach to making decisions that impact the business for positive and sustainable growth.

description:

We are trailblazers setting the stage for the growing new trend in the beverage industry -- making drinking culture inclusive. This is an opportunity to get in at the ground level of emerging wave and demand of niche marketplaces and the quickly expanding nonalcohlic beverage vertical.

We are a team of ex-tech entrepreneurs, consultants, TEDx and global speakers, and brand experts who had to cut back on drinking alcohol for health reasons over the last decade. About Stake Capital

Stake Capital is one of the few full-service quantitative hedge funds operating in the cryptocurrency-digital assets space. Founded in 2017, we offer staking as a service for 15 different protocols and have developed numerous highly sophisticated trading algorithms focused around both arbitrage and liquidations. These systems are operated 24/7 - supported by state of the art infrastructure hosted in major cities across the globe.

The quantitative trading internship is fast-paced and highly competitive. Over the course of six months interns will learn to combine algorithmic trading, quantitative research and cutting edge technology to produce exceptional returns for our investors.

Our internship offers a unique opportunity to work alongside the most experienced and accomplished minds in both quantitative trading and decentralised finance. Throughout the internship you will be mentored by one of our experienced team members.

You will learn to identify, analyse, design, and execute advanced trading strategies using quantitative modelling techniques and statistical analysis. Alongside other interns you will attend workshops where we will teach you the fundamentals of trading and decentralised finance.

We encourage potential applicants to immerse themselves in DeFi through independent research and participation in the ecosystem.

About the company:

Unilingo translates videos for top YouTube creators who want to reach a global audience and increase their ad revenue. We provide tools that make it easy and affordable to translate, distribute, and manage translated IP. In a world where 80% of content consumption is not in English, Unilingo‚Äôs premise is that small to medium sized content creators should have a single system for content translation, distribution, and management to reach a global audience. AI Translation is not good enough, human translation is expensive, no single management system exists to reach new audiences beyond one language, and high production value user-generated content is heavily undersupplied in emerging markets (1MM people come online for the first time each day). Unilingo works with creators with a combined following of 45MM subscribers and 7B lifetime views including WatchMojo and Veritasium 7% MoM viewership growth. description:
The goal of the research fellowship is to provide life science students with an opportunity to participate in exciting research projects and gain experience while learning about bioinformatics. These projects come from a variety of research areas, including oncology, immunology, neuroscience, agrotech, biotech, ecology and others. Each project consists of various datasets, primarily focusing on high throughput -omics technologies.
We are looking for motivated students or postdocs that can assist with bioinformatics project development as they learn from participating in our online programs.

You would be helping diverse teams of students, researchers, and faculty with their analysis and their analysis result communication, contributing detailed project descriptions and tutorials to our training programs. The fellowship requires some time commitment (less than 15 hours per week) but follows a flexible schedule. We meet twice a week for online training, and then one more time a week for a longer time to discuss project and analysis methods.

We are a Pricing software solution.

We allow our customers (CDiscount, CMA CGM, Rent a Car, Kiloutou, Skiset ‚Ä¶) to better manage their prices. With every industry going through an omnichannel revolution with different competitors on every front, Excel is starting to be really behind the curve to manage and optimize pricing. That‚Äôs were we come in with a solution that allows our customer to obtain huge revenue and productivity gains through better price management.

Pricemoov develops revenue optimisation strategies for marketplaces, retail, rental and corporate clients. Different methods are used for this purpose: demand prediction, optimal price optimisation, elasticity estimation methods, customer clustering methods and learning-by-doing methods. Around these building blocks, several modules based on ML methods can be used in the product: alerts, simulations, product intelligence, etc.

We have different operating regimes: The retail/marketplace context requires generic methods with rapid inference frequencies (adaptation to market variations in near-real time) whereas in B2B we create customs models with batch inference on a very large amount of data. The infrastructure to run these models is therefore significantly different.

As part of the Pricemoov Delivery Team, you will have to work on complex and high value-added customer cases.

Missions :

  • Analyze and understand large volumes of data in various fields (rental, logistics, retail, logistics, shipping) in order to identify all revenue optimization levers,
  • Think and design the optimization engines needed to activate these levers,
  • Build, test, and deploy the necessary predictive models (time series prediction, segmentation, etc.),
  • Format results in a clear and concise manner.

Required Profil :
You have excellent qualifications in mathematics and statistics, a strong taste for business issues, as well as a first experience (or personal projects) with Python and the usual Machine Learning algorithms.

  • You have an excellent knowledge of Pandas, Scikit-Learn and SQL,
  • You know how to use and explain the main ML algorithms,
  • You are autonomous, able to make decisions,
  • You are able to solve complex problems,
  • You have a perfect command of English,
  • Mastery of Tableau Software, Dataiku, or AWS are pluses.

Our technical stack :

  • Backend : Python, Redis, Prostgre, SQL, Celery,
  • Frontend : React JS, Redux.js,
  • DevOps : Terraform, Sagemaker, Kubernetes, GitHub, Docker, AWS lambda, AWS,
  • Data : Tableau, Snowflake, Scikit-learn, Python (Data Science), Mixpanel, Kuberflow, Dataiku, Apache Spark

  • Great location: work either from our office in the heart of Paris or remotely,
  • Alan health care, Swile luncheon voucher, 50% of your transportation,
  • Bicycle kilometers are compensated.

Pricemoov is a pricing solution whose mission is to empower revenue managers in the optimization of their margin and income through a better management of their prices,

We've combined our unique pricing expertise and advanced data analytics processes into the simple - yet powerful - Pricemoov Platform which assist our customers in their day-to-day lives and help them capture revenue gains through enhanced pricing strategies.

With a team of 35 and backed by international VCs, we're very well positioned in the pricing software market and maintain huge growth ambition!

Job Description

Position
Job Title - Data Analyst Intern
Company - Haystack Search
Location - REMOTE (Company HQ in Los Angeles)

Haystack Search is seeking a Data Science Intern (Full-time, REMOTE) to join our Data Team for the summer of 2021. We are a Big Data company creating a website and app that allows shoppers to search the shelves of all nearby local stores (national beta: searchhaystack.com). Our solution empowers the struggling retail industry and makes buying from brick and mortar locations as easy and convenient as buying on Amazon -- with quicker delivery.

Job Description/Responsibilities:

  • Develop classification models
  • Use data visualisation techniques to present your results/findings
  • Work on and improve our current data pipelines

Requirements/Qualifications:

  • Detail-oriented and highly motivated self-starter
  • Interest in gaining experience at a growing startup
  • Passionate about data science
  • Enjoy working on open ended problems
  • Comfortable with SQL and Python
  • Experience with classification using machine learning

Nice to have:

  • Experience using transfer learning and/or active learning methodologies
  • Familiarity with NLP
  • Eager to use the likes of TensorFlow, pyTorch, NLTK to solve real world problems
  • Interest in retail or ecommerce

Compensation:

  • Interns will be given course credit when possible, but otherwise the position will be unpaid.

If you‚Äôre interested in this role, forward us your resume and let us know in a short cover letter what excites you as well as why you would be a good fit. Looking forward to hearing from you!

This is not your run of the mill internship. Want to experience what it takes to build and run a venture capital firm? Come be a part of our journey to build Whiteboard Venture Partners. While the position is unpaid, you will be plugged into activities to grow our presence within our evolving network of entrepreneurs, investors, industry and functional experts. Interns are given freedom to shape their internship experiences (we offer a lot of interesting challenges) but are expected to (not limited to)

  1. be a high performing student at a US university program (Bachelors, Masters, Doctorate..)
  2. have natural empathy for entrepreneurs (via direct/indirect experience)
  3. possess a nuanced understanding of the role played by venture capital (firms as well as an asset class)
  4. excel at problem solving and execute on validated recommendations
  5. build/deploy technological solutions to scale the firm's operations

Interested - apply directly here: https://www.whiteboard.vc/fellowapp.html

We consider applicants on a rolling basis and will reach out with next steps based on our current needs.

A BIT ABOUT US
GBatteries was founded six years ago to tackle one of the world‚Äôs most pressing issues: the transition to a cleaner future through electrification. We are pioneering battery technology which enables ultra-fast charging of Li-ion batteries without compromising battery life ‚Äî and without changing the battery‚Äôs chemistry or manufacturing process. Ultimately, our mission is to accelerate the mass adoption of electric vehicles.
We are working on some of the biggest challenges in energy storage, and are looking for the right people to join us as we develop our technology and continue to scale.

THE OPPORTUNITY AND THE ROLE
As a DevOps Engineer on our Software Development team, you'll help us build out the core web applications and tools that will serve to enable our research and development teams to effectively test and analyze state-of-the-art batteries. In our small but growing engineering organization, you'll not only be developing and shipping new features but also designing core aspects of GBatteries' testing and data analysis product.
In this role you‚Äôll build a continuous integration pipeline to allow the Software team to release features faster and more frequently. You‚Äôll be also creating a QA testing framework so that the team can write and run automated tests in a predefined environment. You will be involved in identifying and fixing bugs, documenting our research platform, and providing support to the Research team in using the research platform.

We've not set it in stone, however our preferred salary range for this position is $17-28 per hour, depending on experience and background.

THE TEAM
You‚Äôll join a small but growing software team where everyone‚Äîincluding you‚Äîis striving to constantly improve their knowledge of infrastructure, systems, and cares about creating dependable products. While we are still growing and have plenty to do, we are incredibility supportive of each other and pitch in to support our peers when problems arise.

THE TECH STACK
This is the tech stack our development team works with.
Web Development: React.js, Flask
Data Warehousing: Elasticsearch, PostgreSQL
DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes, Azure, Terraform, Ansible

THE SKILL SET
Computer science or related background
Previous experience in at least 1 software development role in industry

Must haves:

  • Strong proficiency in Python
  • Experience with Git version control (personal projects and/or work experience)
  • Familiar with Docker (personal projects and/or work experience)
  • Familiar with working using the command line in Linux/Unix/Ubuntu (or similar environment)

Nice to haves:

  • Experience with Kubernetes (either deploying applications or managing a cluster)
  • Experience with a cloud service provider (Azure preferred)
  • Experience writing queries for Elasticsearch
  • Experience working with CI/CD pipelines (CircleCI, Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub CI)

WITHIN 1 MONTH, YOU'LL...

  • Become familiar with our vertically integrated technology stack and get a high-level understanding of the projects the team is working on and how they fit in with the company‚Äôs goals
  • Start development on your first Python-based project which will be a continuous integration pipeline to allow the software team to release new features faster and more frequently
  • This tool will be capable of executing/managing Helm charts to deploy new versions of the software to a Kubernetes cluster

WITHIN 2 MONTHS, YOU'LL...

  • Begin working on a QA testing framework that will allow for developers to write and run automated tests in a predefined environment
  • This will be python based, and will be integrated into the CI/CD pipeline built in the previous project

WITHIN 4 MONTHS, YOU'LL...

  • Continue to implement new features for the CI/CD pipeline and QA testing framework you build during your term. This may involve integration with a second Kubernetes cluster hosted in Azure, and any bug fixes that may arise

THE ENGINEERING CULTURE

  • Autonomy: There's no red tape on what technology frameworks you can use, or what language you should be coding in. We believe in using the best tool(s) for the job, and learning any new ones along the way.
  • Scope: You won't be adding small features to a monolithic codebase; you will be building entire products from start to finish. Your team members will recognize you for the products you build and the impact these products have on their workflow. You will have the opportunity to identify the business needs for a particular product, work through the development life cycle, and interact with your customers directly.
  • Interesting Problems: Much of what we do is in uncharted territories. As a result, we are often posed with interesting and challenging engineering problems, which will encourage you to prototype, iterate, and innovate. It's part of the company culture to encourage crazy ideas, and celebrate failures as learning opportunities. Many of the design problems you will encounter won't have answers on Google or Stack Overflow, they will encourage you to come up with unique approaches and strengthen your design thinking.
  • Growth: Working at a start-up is a great way to supercharge your skillset, and accelerate your learning. You will be put in a fast-paced environment where you're always working at the bleeding edge of technology.

WHAT WE OFFER
We are working on many exciting projects towards our ultimate goal of breaking down the final barrier preventing the adoption of electric vehicles; range anxiety. We‚Äôre a growing company working with some of the largest manufacturers in the world, and there‚Äôs still a huge amount to do. Even as an intern joining us, you‚Äôll be able to see the impact of your work from day one and have the opportunity to see the final effect on real world products. We encourage unconventional thinking, and seek resilient problem solvers who aren‚Äôt afraid to get their hands dirty.

During the pandemic, we are operating remote-by-default.

HOW TO APPLY
Is the idea of enabling the global mass adoption of electric vehicles exciting to you? We‚Äôd love to hear from you! To apply please include a short message addressed to Henry Rearden within the application below; no cover letter necessary. If you have any questions, or just want to say hello, feel free to reach out to Vlad Belov on LinkedIn.

We particularly value diversity, and we know that experience comes in many forms. If your unique experience is close to what we‚Äôre looking for, please still consider applying.
